loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Ky, 42, is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn an income running a shop for making shoes at their house. 

He started this business one year ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater quantity of materials and glue to increase his productions of shoes.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of materials and glue to increase his production of shoes.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”PACHAMAMA“;  El socio Rafael tiene 33 años tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente;el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de vidrios, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,el socio a la vez tiene otro negocio de elaboración de muebles en melanina como armarios para cocina entre otros, el socio vende en las ferias de los fines de semana por el centro de la ciudad, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.


El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de vidrios al por mayor.


El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Rafael, 33, is a member of the communal bank ”PACHAMAMA“ and has a son and a live-in partner. He varies his daily activities with his business selling glass, which he has had for several years. It has prospered with the effort he puts in each day. Rafael also makes furniture, such as kitchen cabinets and other items, from melamine. He sells the furniture at weekend fairs in the city center.

Rafael is responsible and works hard to help his family get ahead. He is applying for a loan to buy wholesale glass. He is grateful for the loan offered to him and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy wholesale glass.

loans.name: Miriam Marlenia

texts.es: Miriam, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, pero vive solamente una de sus hijas en el municipio de Olanchito. Hace 12 años que ella estableció su propio negocio en su casa donde vende variedad de golosinas, como galletas, churros, dulces, agua en bolsa, refrescos etc. Además vende lociones por encargo. Este negocio tiene buena demanda, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de refrescos, y surtir de golosinas. Ella quiere que su negocio se mantenga surtido para incrementar sus ganancias. Su meta es lograr que su hija se gradúe para que tenga una mejor vida y también seguir creciendo con el negocio.
texts.en: Miriam, 44, is a single mother of three children but only lives with one of her daughters in Olanchito.  She started her own home-based business 12 years ago selling assorted snacks like cookies, packaged snacks, candy, bags of water, soft-drinks, etc.  She also sells lotions on order.  This business has good demand and the loan she’s requesting will be used to buy soft-drinks and to stock up on snacks.  She wants her business to stay well-stocked to increase profits.  Her goal is that her daughter graduates so that she can have a better life and also to continue growing in business.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is 45 years old and married. She has four children, two daughters and two sons, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. The main source of the family's income is rice farming on one hectare of farmland. Having been in this business for eighteen years, she is able to earn around 30,000 Riel (KHR) per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yields resulting from drought is the main challenge for her rice field. 

Chanthy's group, for whom she is the leader, consists of three members who are all women living in the same village of Sampov Meas district of Pusat province, Cambodia. She has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. She has intelligently used the past loans to progressively improve her current business. 

Now she and her group members are applying for a loan with VisionFund of 1,400,000 KHR each. Chanthy is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay labor fees as she will hire people to help in transplanting rice seedlings. She hopes her rice paddy becomes more profitable so as to keep her children in school and fulfill her dream of running a sculpture business to earn extra income for supporting the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 50-year-old married woman. She lives with her two daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a salesman. For six years, she has run a food stall, selling sweetened porridge to people in her community.

Thu would like a loan to purchase better quality beans and ingredients and make other food to sell from her stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality beans and ingredients and make other foods to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Tan's Group

texts.en:
A mother of four dependent children, two daughters and two sons, Tan is 31 years old and earns a living through farming rice on three hectares of farmland. She has done this for seven years. Her husband supplements the family’s income by working for others for fees. The current business earns them about 21,000 KHR per day and they can save about 6,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Insufficient water supply is the main challenge for Tan’s rice-field business.

Tan has been with VisionFund for four cycles, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Tan fully repaid the past loans, which have helped to support her family in having sufficient food. 

Tan is now leading her group of two members, who live in the same village, to ask for another loan. Tan will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow good-quality rice and make more profit through selling it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farmland.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un infirmier du nom de Hippolyte. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont certains scolarisés. Julienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins, Julienne vend depuis dix ans, divers articles. Parallèlement à cette activité, Julienne vend des boissons et de l'huile de palme. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Julienne s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Julienne sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Julienne is 31 years old and married to Hippolyte, a nurse.  They have three children in their care, some of whom are in school.  Julienne never went to school.  She lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various needs of the household along with her husband.

In order to help provide for the family, Julienne has been selling various goods for the past ten years.  Additionally, she sells drinks and palm oil.  Thanks to her activity, she is able to meet her needs without much difficulty.  She buys her goods in Benin and in Nigeria.

To ensure the satisfaction of her customers, and also to increase her turnover and income, Julienne is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  This loan will help her to raise the level of her activity, attract more customers and increase her income.  Her first loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, drinks and other products.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”PACHAMAMA“;  El socio Carlos tiene 37 años tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente;el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de de compra y venta de zapatillas, el socio viaja cada cierto tiempo a la ciudad de Tacna para comprar su mercadería para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que más le solicitan ,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,el socio a la vez alquila un carro para brindar el servicio de taxi en su tiempo libre, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.


El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de zapatillas para su negocio.


El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: Carlos, 37, has a spouse and three children.  He’s a member of the “Pachamama” communal bank.  He alternates his daily chores with a business buying and selling slippers.  He travels every so often to the city of Tacna to buy his merchandise to then resell to his customers who most request it.  He’s been in business for a good length of time and does well thanks to the effort he puts into it.  He also leases a car to provide transportation services in his free time.  He is a responsible, diligent man who supports hi family this way.  He’s requesting the loan to buy slippers for his business.  He’s grateful for the granted loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy slippers.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es soltero y no tiene hijos vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona El Rosario de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como contador por más de diez horas al día en una empresa privada ya que debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que le será de mucha ayuda en su trabajo.
El sueño de Juan es mejorar sus ingresos para poder independizarse y tener más comodidad, también mejorara su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Juan’s single and has no children yet.  He lives in his parents’ house occupying a single bedroom.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s El Rosario zone.  He earns income working as an accountant for more than ten hours daily in a private firm since he must cover his food and basic utility costs.  He needs the loan to buy a computer because it will be very useful in his work.  Juan’s dream is to improve his income so that he can become independent and have more comfort and also to improve his quality of life.  This is his second loan request to Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 55 years old, and is divorced. She has been running a cafe and a general store in front of her home for ten years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her three children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Huong is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more products such as sugar, milk, and soft drinks to sell from her store and increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more products such as sugar, milk, and soft drinks to sell from her store.

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en:
Saran is 26 years old and married. She has two dependent children, one daughter and one son, both of whom are too young for school. To support the family, she has been farming rice and raising pigs for several years, and also works for others for a fee. She can earn about 15,000 Riel (KHR) per day and save about 5,000 Riel (KHR) each day for future needs. Lacking water for supporting her rice field is the main challenge for her business. 

Saran's group, for which she is the leader, consists of four women who live in the same village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She and her group members are first-time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. 

Saran will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for labor costs in transplanting rice seedlings. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for farm labor

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como gallinas y cuyes,la socia tambien sigue trabajando como profesora,en el negocio de crianza de animales la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados,la socia ya tiene mas de 10 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar alimentos para los animales y comprar cuyes y gallinas.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues making a living in the business of raising animals like chickens and guinea pigs. She also continues working as a teacher. In the business of raising animals she makes them fatten and grow and then sells them in different markets. She already has more than ten years in this business. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell animals. 

She is applying for the loan to buy food for the animals and to buy guinea pigs and chickens. She is happy with the loan and is committed to complying with her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy food for her animals and to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks to rear for sale.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 39 years old and is married. She has two sons and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a salesman.

She has run a food stall to sell beverages and sweetened porridge for six years. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of ingredients to make different foods to sell to her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of ingredients to make different foods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jack Harrison

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de libreria,el socio vende cuadernos,lapices,libros y cuadernos,el socio tambien sigue ofreciendo servicio de fotocopiadora,impresiones,anillados entre otros servicios,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio,en sus tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear con sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de libreria y fotocopiadora.El socio solicita el credito para comprar una fotocopiadora para su negocio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jack Harrison is still devoted to the bookstore business.  He sells notebooks, pencils, and books.  He also still offers photocopying, printing, and binding services among other services.  He has been in this business for 8 years.  In his free time he likes going for a walk with his children.  His dream is to extend the bookstore business and photocopying.  He is requesting a loan to buy a copier for his business.

He is happy for the loan and promises to meet his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a copier for his business.

loans.name: Phu

texts.en: Phu, 33, is married and has a daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife started a shop making garments four years ago. This shop helps them to maintain their living conditions. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of material to increase his production of garments. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of material to increase his production of garments

loans.name: Sharipa

texts.ru:
Шарипе 53 года, мать 6 детей. Шарипа в качестве основного дохода с 2007 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 15,000 сом, потраченной на покупку телки. Благодаря упорному труду Шарипы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова, 2 теленка,10 овец, 1 лошадь, 2 га земли с кукурузой и клевером, ежемесячный доход составляет около 5,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шарипа обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения доходов от сдачи молока.  Доходы от кредита Шарипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в ближайшем будущем планирует провести женитьбу сына.
texts.en:
Sharipa is 53, and she has 6 children. Animal farming has been Sharipa's main source of income since 2007, her having started the business with buying a cow for 15,000 KGS. Thanks to Sharipa's hard work, her farm currently has a dairy cow, 2 calves, 10 sheep, a horse, and 2 hectares of corn and clover fields. Her monthly income is some 5,000 KGS.
To grow her business further, Sharipa has applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS for purchasing a dairy cow to increase her income from milk sales. Sharipa plans to invest her income from the loan into growing her headcount further, and she plans to pay for her son's wedding in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Wangninagbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement WANGNINAGBE est composé de quinze personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Joulienne est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Joulienne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Joulienne est âgée de 33 ans et est marié à un chauffeur du nom de Antoine. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Joulienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Joulienne  assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Joulienne exerce depuis une dizaine d’années, la vente de fruits. Parallèlement à cette activité, Joulienne vend de l'huile de palme qu'elle produit à base de noix de palme à son domicile. Joulienne s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Joulienne et les autres membres du groupement WANGNINAGBE sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité. Les premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The WANGNINAGBE group consists of fifteen members who are friends and live in the same village. 

Joulienne, the group's representative, is the one raising her hand in the photo. It is the third time that the members  of this group are requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their activity and to better meet their customers' demand.

Joulienne never went to school.  She is 33 years old and married to a driver named Antoine. Joulienne and Antoine have three children, some of whom attend school.  All three children are their dependents.  Parents and children live together, and the couple jointly takes care of the various expenses of the family. 

To help provide for the family, Joulienne has been selling fruits for the past ten years or so.  Additionally, she sells palm oil, which she produces at home, using palm nuts.  She buys her supplies in a region of Benin. 

In order to strengthen their activity and to better meet the needs of their customers, Joulienne and the other members of the WANGNINAGBE group are requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  Their ambition is to increase their level of activity.  

Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fruits and palm nuts.

loans.name: En's Group

texts.en:
En lives with her husband and four daughters, some of whom are still in school and some of whom help the family’s business. She is 52 years old and makes a living through farming rice on 4 hectares of farmland while her husband helps the family generate income by making palm juice. Engaging in this business for ten years, En and her husband can earn about KHR 20,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day after deducting daily expenses. Drought destroying the crop yield is the main challenge for her business.

En’s group consists of five female members who live in Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, and this is the second loan for her group with VisionFund. The first loan has relieved her family’s burden and improved their living conditions. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan from VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to gain more income so as to keep her children in school and also fulfill her dream of buying plots of farmland for expanding her farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Giau

texts.en:
Giau is 24 years old and is married with a son. Her husband is a hired driver. Giau has been running a business of selling garlic and onion for 2 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Giau is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more good quality onions and garlic to sell to her customers. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more good quality onions and garlic to sell

loans.name: Sort's Group

texts.en:
Sort resides in a rural area of Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is 40 years old and married with four children, three of whom are dependent. Some are still in school and some work at a garment factory. To support the family, Sort has been in the business of selling grocery items for fifteen years. She can earn about 42,000KHR per day and manages to save approximately 10,000KHR each day for her daily savings.        
                                                                     
This is the second microloan for Sort’s group with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loan which has helped her to relieve the family’s burden and improve the family's standard of living. Now leading her group of three to seek a loan with VisionFund of 1,200,000 each, Sort, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more grocery items for selling, such as sugars, eggs and salt etc. She hopes to expand her grocery business and gain more income from it in order to run another business to earn extra income for the family.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for selling

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, who is 37 years old, resides with her husband and four children at West Point.  Her children are between the ages of 5 and 19 and are currently in school. 

She sells sardines, rice, milk, tomatoes, toothpaste, and washing and bath soap in the market. She was taught to sell by her mother. She has been involved in her business for the past ten years.   She likes her business because she generate profits from the business, and with the profit, she buys more goods to improve her business and attends to the needs of her children.  

She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, sardines, washing soap, and milk for her business.  Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sardines, soap, and milk.

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en:
Sarim lives in a house with a thatched roof in a village of Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is 28 years old and married, with three children, one of whom is in school and the other two are under school age. 

She has been farming rice on one hectare of farmland.  Her husband also complements the family’s income by making palm juice and working for others for a fee.  In this business for eight years, together they can earn about KHR 15,000 per day and build on KHR 10,000 for saving. Lacking water supply is the main challenge for her business. 

Sarim's group consists of three members who live in the same village; this is the group's first loan with VisionFund.  As the group's leader, Sarim will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. 

She hopes to grow her rice with good quality and higher yield, so as to sell it for a good price in order to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor fees for her farmland

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 32 years old and lives in Paynesville South. She’s married with 2 children (aged 3 and 9).  One of her children lives at home, and one attends school. For the last 8 years, she has been selling milk, biscuits, sugar, etc. Maria has requested this loan so that she can purchase more goods (milk, biscuits, sugar, etc). She says her problem is having a low inventory. She started in this business by helping her mother in a shop, and in turn, learning her profession. Working in this business makes her proud, because it helps her to send her children to school. In the future, she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: To purchase more goods (milk, biscuits, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Eva Jackeline

texts.es:
La socia Eva Jackeline se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes,gallinas y chanchos y anteriormente se dedicaba la negocio de snack cafeteria pero no le fu muy bien entonces decidio a cambiar al negocio de crianza de animales el cual tiene 4 meses,la socia vende en el mercado desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales y tener un local.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes,gallinas y cahnchos y alimentos para los animles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Eva Jackeline makes a living through the business of raising animals like guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs.  Before she made a living though a snack cafe, but it did not go very well so then she decided to switch to the business of animal husbandry, which she has done for four months.  The member sells in the market from 9:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  Her dream is to grow her husbandry business and have a place for it.  

She asks for the loan in order to buy guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and feed for the animals.  The member is happy for the loan and promises to complete the payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Chay's Group

texts.en:
Chay is 42 years old and single.   She is a villager residing in a rural area of Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia.

She makes a living through growing cassava on four hectares of farmland, which she has done for five years. The current business earns her about KHR 50,000 per day to meet her needs.

Chay has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while the other member of her group has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans have helped her to improve her standard of living. Now she is leading her group of two to seek a loan of KHR 200,000 each. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to increase income from this business so as to make her living standards better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Kankalay Group

texts.en:
Serreh is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Serreh was born in southern Sierra Leone 46 years ago. She is married with six children – two in primary school, two in secondary school, and two in college. 

For many years now, Serreh has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. This is the first loan that Serreh and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, making more sales and consequently improving their living conditions. 

Serreh will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,800,000) to expand her business.  She will buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc., wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc., wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is 40 years old and the married mother of five children. She lives in Kakata and three of her children stay with her at home while her oldest child lives independently outside the home. For the past eight years, Yassah has been selling rubber bowls, bucket, plates, spoons, and drinking glasses. She learned her business from her mother and started with a little income that she had been saving.

Yassah is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber bowels, buckets, plates, and spoons. She hopes her loan will increase her sales. In the future, Yassah plans to build a house and give her children better education.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber bowels, buckets, plates, and spoons to sell

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”PACHAMAMA“;  El socio José Luis tiene 20 años y es soltero ;el socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindado el servicio de taxi ,el socio alquila un auto para trabajar desde las 07:00am hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamente, él socio lleva buen tiempo en este su trabajo el cual combina con sus estudios ya que el socio es estudiante de topografía el socio recién empezó a estudiar y espera poder terminar su carrera, el socio piensa recortar su horario de trabajo para poder estudiar, el es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que el socio sale adelante.


El socio solicita el préstamo para pagar su matrícula del instituto.


El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
José Luis belongs to the “PACHAMAMA” (“Mother Earth” in the Quechua language) communal bank.  He is 20 years old and single.  He alternates his daily activities with providing a taxi service.  He rents a car for his work, and generally works from 7:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night.  José Luis has worked in this job for a good amount of time, and combines it with his studies, since he is studying to be a surveyor.  He recently began his studies and hopes to finish his degree; he is thinking of reducing the number of hours he works so he can study more.  José Luis is very responsible and hardworking, and that is how he is trying to get ahead.

José Luis is asking for this loan so he can pay his university tuition.

He is grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Hay's Group

texts.en:
Hay is 60 years old and is married with seven children. She lives in a rural area of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. The main source of Hay's family income is from rice farming on one hectare of farmland. Her husband also works as a village chief. Having been farmers for 25 years, Hay and her husband can earn about 12,000 KHR per day and are able to save about 6,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Hay's main business challenge is drought. 
 
Hay is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She is the leader of a three-member loan group that is requesting its first loan through the Kiva partner, VisionFund. Hay hopes that her loan will help increase her crop yield so she can earn more income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 61 years old. He is from the Samtredia district of West Georgia, and lives with his wife, two sons (19 and 20 years old), and his mother. His mother is provided with a retirement pension and the couple's elder son is a serviceman who gets a monthly salary. Nestor runs a small dairy business and has four milk cows and a calf. His wife milks the cows and produces cheese products. In addition, the family has a greenhouse where they grow different kinds of greens, cucumbers, and tomatoes. Nestor's family sells an average of 80 kilograms of cheese, 1500 kilograms of greens, and 1200 kilograms of vegetables per month. Nestor is a very hardworking person who has a great deal of experience in his work.

Nestor is requesting a loan to purchase building materials and expand his family's greenhouse. After the greenhouse has expanded, he will be able to sow more greens and vegetables and will be able to get a good harvest. This will significantly increase his family's income. With his increased income, Nestor will renovate his house which is old and damaged.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to expand his greenhouse

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 38-year-old lady, married to Peter and mother of three children.

She does farming in Kimende in the outskirts of Limuru town, and she has been in this business for six years now. Susan gets a monthly income of KES 30,000.

This will be Susan's third loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow and start dairy farming. In future she wants to be a successful farmer in Limuru.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mahudjro 20 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJRO 20 est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à une même association d'artisans. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Bernard, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Bernard est âgé de 46 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Augustine. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Bernard a peu fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. Il y a près de quinze ans que Bernard exerce cette activité de couture à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Bernard s’approvisionne en fournitures de couture dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Bernard désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Bernard sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe  MAHUDJRO 20, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group Mahudjro 20 is made up of three people who belong to the same association of artisans. Bernard is the representative of this group, and he is shown in the photo with his hand raised. This is the third time that this group is seeking financial support from Alidé with the aim of growing their businesses.

Bernard is 46 years old and is married to a merchant named Augustine. The couple has five children, some of whom are in school and all of whom are their dependents. Apart from their own children, the couple has two additional children in their care. Bernard has had very little schooling, but learned instead how to sew. For nearly fifteen years Bernard has been running his sewing business from his home, which has allowed him to support his family. 

Bernard purchases his sewing supplies in a city of Benin. In order to better meet the demand of his customers, Bernard wants to expand his business. With this in mind, Bernard, along with the other members of the group Mahudjro 20, is seeking a third loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es soltera y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica al comercio trabajando por más de diez horas al día vendiendo zapatos realizando viajes para la compra y venta de los mismos ya que con lo que gana debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos, también cuenta con un vehículo el cual lo hace trabajar como taxi y le entregan rentas diarias.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de motor de su vehículo ya que es una de sus fuentes de ingreso.
El sueño de Paulina, es mejorar sus ingresos y comprarse una casa para poder acoger a sus hijos y también mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Paulina is single, and has two children who are already living on their own. She lives in her parents' home, occupying just one room. The house is located in the Obispo Bosque area of the city of La Paz.

Currently she has a small business, working more than ten hours a day selling shoes, and making trips to buy and sell them. With what she earns, she must cover her expenses for food, and pay for basic services. She also has a vehicle that she has working as a taxi, and she receives daily rent. 

She needs the loan to purchase an engine for her vehicle, as this is one of her sources of income. 

Paulina's dream is to improve her income, and buy herself a house so that can take in her children and also improve her quality of life. This is the third time she has applied for a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy an engine for her vehicle that is used as a taxi.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is 64 years old and widowed. She has two children and lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.  

Le runs a cafe to earn a living. She started her business twelve years ago. She intends to take a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of different beverages and coffee to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different beverages and coffee.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is from the Khoni district of West Georgia. She is 47 years old, divorced, and lives with her 19-year-old son and 18-year-old daughter. Her son is a serviceman and gets a monthly income. 

Lili runs an animal husbandry business.  She has three milk cows and two calves. She milks the cows and produces cheese products. The family also has a plot of land where maize and potatoes are grown. Lili sells her agricultural production at the local market. She is very hard-working person, with a great desire to get ahead.

Lili requests a loan to repair her house. The existing house is old and damaged. She will purchase building materials and renovate her house. 

Then the living conditions of the family will be improved, and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Lili hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy materials and repair her house.

loans.name: Zaib-Un-Nisa's Group

texts.en:
Zaib-un-nisa, a 51-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Pakistan with her husband, 2 sons, and 2 daughters. One son and both daughters are studying, and her husband is an auto mechanic. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Zaib-un-nisa is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future.

Zaib-un-nisa is a member of an 8-person group and has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Tsutsa

texts.en:
Tsutsa is 32 years old. She is from Samtredia district of West Georgia. She lives with her husband and two children (4 and 8 years old).  The elder child goes to the local school. Tsutsa’s husband works as a hammer-smith in his iron shop and gets a monthly income. 

Tsutsa runs an animal husbandry business.  She has four milk cows, two calves, and a pig, and she sells 10 to 12 piglets per year. She milks the cows and produces cheese products. The family sells on average 80 kg of cheese per month. They also have a plot of land where maize is grown. In addition, Tsutsa is involved in market-gardening and sows different kinds of vegetables in family-owned land. 

She requested a loan to purchase 10 young buffaloes and expand the cattle shed. The loan will help her to provide for their needs. She will raise them and expand her dairy farm. This will significantly increase the income of the family. 

With the increased income, Tsutsa plans to renovate her house, which is damaged. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase 10 young buffaloes.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 31 years old and a clothes dealer in Mombasa, a business he has been running for the past eight years with great success. Simon is married to Kezia, and together they are blessed with one child who is nine months old.

This marks Simon's second business loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more trousers, bed covers, and curtains. He will use the anticipated profits to buy additional stock and repay his loan. He hopes to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase more trousers, bed covers, and curtains

loans.name: Sapah Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sapah” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 6,700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Hawanatu is the leader of this group. Hawanatu is 26-year-old, married with 1 child who is attending primary school. Hawanatu sells clothes and has been in this business for 7 years now. With the help of this loan, Hawanatu will invest in her business by buying different kinds of clothes and in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of clothes and in large quantity to add to her business inventory

loans.name: David M.s.'s Group

texts.en: Pictured here are teachers from on the primary school in Jui, an outskirt of Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. These teachers have come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org to request a loan of 1,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones each in order to solve certain financial challenges they are encountering. And at the end of each month, using their monthly salaries, these teachers can repay the loan. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayments on their behalf. David is the featured leader of this group. A native of Buedu, the 52 year old man is married to a trader and the couple has 4 school going children. A teacher for many years now, David is pursuing further studies in college. He has requested this loan in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees

loans.name: Dúo Princesas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
Dúo Princesas del Mar.
Este Grupo está Conformado por la señora Delfy   Ethelvina  de 34 años de edad es originaria de patzún tiene un hijo, se dedica a su negocio que es una tienda de trajes típicos, ya que desde pequeña  ayudaba a su mama en su venta que tenía, entonces aprendió  todo sobre el negocio, y eso la  llevo a colocar su propia venta, ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de ropa típica y tener  más estilos ya que eso le genera más ganancias a ella espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que necesita para seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Delfy Ethelvina is a member of the "Dúo Princesas del Mar" group. She is 34, has one son, and is from Patzún. She works at her business, which is a store selling typical dress. 

From an early age, she helped her mother selling in the shop she had. Then she learned everything about the business, and that led her to set up her own store. 

She is applying for this loan to buy typical dress, and to have more styles, as that generates more earnings for her. She hopes that they will be able to give her the support she needs to continue moving forward with her business.

loans.use: To buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: La socia es la señora Agueda, ella tiene 74 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos adultos, la socia se dedica a la confección y venta de tejidos como mantas y tapices, pero también comercializa maíz para jora, que es el principal insumo para la elaboración de la chicha de jora, Agueda realiza este trabajo hace muchos años y esta le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y ahora le proporciona los medios económicos para vivir. Agueda en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar lanas de alpaca y oveja para la elaboración de sus tejidos, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a mantenerse en su actividad, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Agueda pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón Salvador del Mundo” del distrito de San Salvador de la  provincia de Calca en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member is Señora Aqueda, she is 74 years old, and married with four adult children.  She makes a living through making and selling woven cloth like blankets and tapestries, but she also sells "maiz para jora" (a type of yellow corn) which is the main ingredient for making "chicha de jora" (a traditional alcoholic drink).  Agueda has done this work for many years, and it has allowed her to get her family ahead in life and it now provides her with the financial means to live.

This time Agueda is asking for the loan in order to buy alpaca and sheep wool to make her woven cloth.  For this reason she is very grateful to Kiva, and for helping her to keep her work.  She promises to complete the payments on time.  Agueda belongs to the communal bank "Patrón Salvador del Mundo" in the district of San Salvador in the province of Calca in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy corn for making chicha and wool for weaving.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu, 32, is a single mother. She lives at Kakata with her three children, who are between the ages of 3  and 18, and are in school.  She stopped her own education in the sixth grade.

Fatu has a table adjacent to the super market where she has been selling bananas, oranges,  plums, and pineapples for the past five years. She started in this business  with a small amount that she received from a friend; now, with the profits it generates, she buys more goods to sell and attends to the needs of her  children. Fatu is requesting  a loan to purchase more bananas, oranges, and plums for the business.  Her plan for the future is to continue to educate her  children.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, oranges, and plums for the business.

loans.name: Changawa

texts.en: Changawa is a 47 year old fish monger in Mombasa. She is a single mother of two children, and has been running her business successfully for the last twenty years. This marks her second business loan after recently being introduced to KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase more tilapia, Nile perch fish and sardines to resell to her customers. The anticipated profits will be used to buy more stock of fish and pay school fees for her children. She hopes to realize more profits from her sales and thus be able to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more tilapia, Nile perch fish and sardines

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 33 year old tailor in Mombasa. She is married to Musyoki, and together they are blessed with three children aged 12, 6 and 3. She has been making clothes for her customers for the past thirteen years, and is doing great. This is Grace’s third loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase a new, modern sewing machine, as well as sewing threads and clothing materials. She will use the anticipated profits from the loan to repay it and to educate her children. She hopes to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to purchase a new, modern sewing machine, as well as sewing threads and clothing materials.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 26 and lives with her partner Meja. She is the mother of one child and a street vendor who sells new and used clothing. She has a very well-established clientele, as she has been working in this sector since last year.

She wants very much to have her own boutique someday, as well as to hire employees to assist her with sales. She wants her business to continue prospering, as it has been with the help of her husband, so that she can provide a quality life for her child.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy more articles of clothing. She has orders she would like to be able to fill, and this will enable her to have greater variety.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 40 years old, married, and a father of four children. For the last ten years, he has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables in Malindi town. He earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES to buy more tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, and onions for resale. Festus will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his children's school fees as well as expand the business. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that he may improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa, 28, lives in Kakata with her husband and three children aged 2-13. Her husband is a businessman, and her children are currently in school. For the past fifteen years, Theresa has had a shop in the general market where she sells radios and other electrical appliances. She learned to sell from her mother, and she likes this type of business because she makes profits that enable her to buy more goods and help her husband with the household  expenses. Theresa has requested a loan to purchase more radios and electrical appliances to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more radios and electrical appliances to increase her sales.

loans.name: Armazi

texts.en:
Armazi is from Tkibuli district. He is 64 years old and lives with his wife Nargiza. Nargiza is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own the garden where nuts and apples are grown. They have a vineyard as well and produce wine. Armazi is involved in the family husbandry business. He has 2 milk cows, 2 calves, 2 oxen and goats. Nargiza produces dairy products.  The family sells their agricultural production locally. Armazi works hard, but he still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings and expand his agricultural business.

Armazi requested a loan to fence the garden. He will purchase building materials. The fence will protect nuts from animals and Armazi will be able to harvest more production. This will increase the income of the family. Armazi will reinvest in his agricultural business to expand and make it more profitable. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to fence the garden

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 25 years old, married, and a father of one child. For the last four years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transportation services in Malindi town. He earns a monthly profit of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his second loan, 60,000 KES. He will use a portion of the loan to service and repair his motorbike and use the remainder to put up a fruit and vegetable kiosk for his wife to run for additional income.

Elijah will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his child. His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to service and repair his motorbike and put up a fruit and vegetable kiosk

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year she has been working hard to manage her small business selling phone accessories. 

To help expand her business, Deborah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phone accessories such as chargers and batteries, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve her family’s standard of living. She hopes that in the future she will be able to get her young siblings into a good school. 

Deborah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories such as chargers and batteries

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is from the Tskaltubo district of West Georgia. She is 46 years old and lives with her husband, son, and parents-in-law. Her parents-in-law have a retirement pension. The family’s economic activities are two greenhouses where cucumbers and different kinds of greens are grown. Nana does all the relevant seasonal work to ensure a good harvest. In addition, she runs a small dairy farm and has 4 milk cows whose milk is used for cheese production. Her agricultural and dairy production is sold at the local open market.

Nana works hard to generate some savings and expand her agricultural business. She requested a loan to purchase organic fertilizers for her greenhouses. The loan will help her to provide financially for her needs. After fertilization and the appropriate agricultural work, Nana will have a good-quality harvest and sell it for a good price, increasing her family's income. The increased income will be reinvested in her agricultural business to expand and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers for her greenhouses

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”PACHAMAMA“;  El socio Rubén tiene 37 años tiene 03 hijos y es casado;el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de joyas en plata como aretes, collares, pulseras entre otros, el socio cuenta con un pequeño taller que se encuentra ubicado en su casa, él socio lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,el socio distribuye su mercadería a sus clientes que más le solicitan como tiendas de turismo entre otros, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.


El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de pulidores y piedras marinas.
El socio sale ne la foto con uno de sus hijos.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the ”Pachamama" communal bank. Rubén is 37 years old, married, and has three children. He alternates his daily activities with his business making silver jewelery, such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets and other items.

He has a small workshop located in his home. He has been in this business for some time, and it is going well thanks to the effort that he puts into it. 

Rubén distributes his merchandise to his customers who request them most, such as tourist shops and other outlets. He is a responsible and hard-working person, as this is how he is helping his family get ahead in life. 

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy polishers and beach stones. He is shown in the photo with one of his children.

Rubén feels grateful for the loan granted, and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: To buy polishers and beach stones.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is from the Samtredia district of West Georgia. He is 27 years old and lives with his grandfather, his wife, and their 2-year-old son. His grandfather is provided with a retirement pension. According to government estimations the family falls into the vulnerable poor category, and they get monthly social assistance. 
	
David runs an animal husbandry business; he has 3 milk cows, two calves, and a pig, and sells 10-12 piglets per year. His wife milks the cows and produces cheese products. David sells on average 60 kg of cheese per month. He also has a plot of land where maize is grown. He works hard to save some money and improve the living conditions of the family. 

David has requested a loan to build a greenhouse. With this credit, he will purchase the building materials and do the construction. He will sow different kinds of vegetables and greens in the greenhouse to sell at a good price. This will increase the income of the family, which will allow David to expand his agricultural business and build an additional greenhouse. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg, who is 51 years old, has two children: a daughter and a son. His son is a pupil, and his daughter is a first-year student at Yerevan State University in the department of Romance and Germanic languages and literature. 

Gevorg and his family live in Vanadzor. Gevorg works as a locksmith, and his wife works as an accountant's assistant. Due to their jobs, they are able to provide for their family. Gevorg is asking for a loan of 225,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to pay for his daughter’s tuition fee for her first semester at the University.

loans.use: to pay his daughter’s tuition fee for her first semester at the University

loans.name: Aneela's Group

texts.en: Aneela is a 20 year old woman who lives in Pakistan with her husband and daughter. Her husband is a security guard whose income is too low to cover their household expenses. Aneela herself has been running a beauty salon for 2 years. As a member of an 8-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cosmetic products like lipstick, facial creams, etc. as well as chairs for her salon. With the profits she will first pay back her loan to Kiva, and then she will purchase a variety of cosmetic products for the salon. Aneela’s dream is to open a new beauty parlour and to get good profits from that. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so co-operative.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and cosmetic products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of foods and beverages to stock in her store.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is a 38-year-old independent woman living in Pakistan with her husband, two daughters and two sons. All of her children are studying in school. Rehana is a very hard-working tailor, while her husband is a retired government officer. He is getting a pension but it is not enough to fulfill their needs. They are living in a rented house and sometimes she doesn't have enough money to pay the rent. 

As a member of 2 person lending group, Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to open a new tailoring shop and to purchase new sewing machines, chairs and clothing material for that shop. She dreams of a better future for her children, and prays for them that they never face any problems in their future. Ameen.

loans.use: to open a new tailoring shop and to purchase new sewing machines, chairs and clothing material for that shop.

loans.name: Jose Ignacio

texts.es:
José, es casado vive en casa de su suegra, tiene cuarenta y un año de edad,tiene tres hijos de cinco, tres y once años de edad, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos para llevar el sustento a su familia, lo aprendió de sus padres, tiene mucha experiencia, trabaja propio todos los días ó dependiendo  de la temporada agrícola.
Ha solicitado un crédito por que lo necesaria para comprar seis  sacos de abono, para fortalecer la cosecha y obtener mejor resultado, esto le ayudara a tener el dinero suficiente  para invertirlo en el cultivo y sacar una buena productividad de granos básicos. 
Sus sueños y aspiraciones son crecer económicamente y dar lo necesario a  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose is married and lives in his mother-in-law's house.  He is 41 years old, and he has three children aged 5, 3 and 11.  He is a farmer who cultivates staple grains to support his family.  He learned to farm from his parents.  He has a lot of experience and he works on his own.  He works daily, or on a schedule that is dependent upon the agricultural season.

He has requested a loan because he needs to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer so that he can strengthen his crops and get a better harvest.  This will help him to have enough money to invest in his crops, so that he will get a good output of staple grains.

His dreams and aspirations are to grow economically and provide for his children's needs.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 27 years old, married and a mother of one child. She operates a tailoring shop in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last four years. She earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of 21,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to purchase some clothing material for her business in preparation for the oncoming festive season.

She will save the anticipated profit and help pay her child's school fees. In the future, Gladys hopes to grow her tailoring shop, as she intends to open a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: to purchase some clothing material for her business.

loans.name: Mahoulome Group

texts.fr: MAHOULOME est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village et s'approvisionnent au même endroit. Le représentant du groupe, Félix (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 32 ans et est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Rachelle. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont certains sont scolarisés. Parmi les trois enfants, deux sont leurs propres enfants. Félix et sa femme vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Félix a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire, et a appris ensuite le métier de coiffure. Félix est un coiffeur et exerce cette activité depuis près de quinze ans. De façon secondaire, Félix vend des chaussures par le système de distribution. Félix achète les produits de coiffure et en chaussures au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Félix sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOULOME. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
MAHOULOME is a group which consists of three members who live in the same village and get their supplies from the same source.

Félix, the group's representative, is raising his hand in the photo. He is 32 years old and married to a hairdresser named Rachelle. Félix and Rachelle have three children in their care, some of whom attend school.  Two of the children are their own children.  Félix and his wife live together with their children, and jointly take care of the various expenses associated with raising them. 

Félix left school at the elementary level and then learned to become a hairdresser.  He has worked in this field for the past fifteen years now.  Additionally, he sells shoes through the distribution system.  He buys his hairdressing supplies and shoes in Togo.

To ensure his customers' satisfaction, Félix is requesting a fourth loan, along with the other members of the MAHOULOME group.  This loan will help them to better meet their customers' expectations and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing supplies (hair clipper etc...) and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, oil, milk, sausages and meats.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна использовала последний кредит от КИВА для того, чтобы пополнить товар на своей торговой точке, за счет чего существенно увеличилась ее выручка. 
В этот раз Татьяна обратилась в КИВА за кредитом в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы снова пополнить свой ассортимент товара, увеличив количество демисезонной и зимней обуви, на которую уже появился спрос в Украине.
texts.en:
Tatyana used her last loan from Kiva to replenish the stock of footwear that she sells at her sales outlet. This allowed her to substantially increase her revenue.

Tatyana has once again come to Kiva for a loan of 4,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia (UAH) so she can increase the quantity and range of autumn and winter footwear, for which there is already a demand in Ukraine.

loans.use: to increase her stock of autumn and winter footwear to meet seasonal demand

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Doña Consuelo es originaria de aldea Xenimajuyu ella cuenta con una pequeña tienda de productos comestibles de consumo diario desde hace años ella empezó con su negocio y gracias a Dios Poco a poco ha crecido, su esposo trabaja como albañil y gracias al apoyo de él ha podido salir adelante en su negocio, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera necesidad, el sueño de ella es tener un negocio más grandes y así apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Consuelo is originally from the small town of Xenimajuyu. She has had a small store selling food products for a number of years. She started the business, and thanks to God it has grown little by little. Her husband works as a construction worker, and thanks to his support she has been able to make headway with her business. She is requesting the loan to purchase primary-need food products. Her dream is to have a bigger business and thus help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase primary-need food products.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина работает на рынке – она торгует детской одеждой уже 10 лет. В основном есть спрос на кофты, костюмчики, курточки – родители хорошо берут такой товар. У Ирины свое торговое место, за счет чего получается экономить на аренде. 
Ирине нужен кредит в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить теплую детскую одежду для сезонной реализации.
texts.en:
Irina works at the market and has been selling children's clothing for 10 years. The main demand is for sweaters, jumpsuits, and jackets, which parents buy in large quantities. Irina has a stall at the market, thanks to which she is able to save on rent. 

Irina is seeking a loan of 4,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia (UAH) in order to stock up on warm children's clothing to meet seasonal demand.

loans.use: to purchase warm children's clothes to meet seasonal demand

loans.name: Hermelinda Obdulia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de lenceria,la socia vende polos y truzas,ella tiene una tienda donde vende esta lenceria,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la lenceria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar polos y truzas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member continues dedicating herself to her business selling lingerie. She has a store selling polo shirts and undergarments. She has eight years of experience in the business, and in her free time she likes to go on walks. Her dream is to have a bigger store to sell lingerie. She is requesting the loan to purchase polo shirts and undergarments. She feels happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase polo shirts and undergarments.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 44 years old, married and a mother of five children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 9,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES to buy additional dairy equipment such as milk cans, milking gloves and water cans for the cows used in her business. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as to expand her farming activities. 

Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with the aim of increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy equipment such as milk cans, milking gloves and water cans.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut would like to take another loan to buy good quality ingredients and food to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and
increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and food for her food stall.

loans.name: Ayitchedote Group

texts.fr: AYITCHEDOTE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amis et résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Mondoukpè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Djimon. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Mondoukpè et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Mondoukpè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Mondoukpè mène comme activité la vente d'huile à moteur et de gasoil à son domicile. Mondoukpè exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Mondoukpè s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et aussi au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mondoukpè sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe AYITCHEDOTE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
AYITCHEDOTE is a three-person group whose members all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. 

The group representative, Mondoukpè (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 37 and is married to a mechanic named Djimon. The couple has four dependent children who all go to school. Mondoukpè and her husband live with their children and take care of their expenses. Mondoukpè did not go to school. 

For close to 10 years, Mondoukpè has been selling engine oil and diesel oil out of her home. Mondoukpè is a passionate worker, and this allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children. Mondoukpè buys her supplies in a city in Benin and also in Nigeria. 

With the goal of satisfying her clients, the members of AYITCHEDOTE and Mondoukpè are asking for a second loan. This loan will help them better respond to the needs of their clients and to increase their profits. Their first loan was repaid.

loans.use: to buy cans of engine oil and diesel oil.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Joséphine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 55 ans et est une veuve. Joséphine a neuf enfants dont certains scolarisés et dont deux restent sa charge. Joséphine vit seule avec ses deux enfants restants et assure seule ses différents besoins et ceux de ses enfants à charge. Joséphine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Joséphine vend divers articles (charbon de bois, etc.) et des fournitures scolaires à son domicile. Joséphine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Joséphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Joséphine sollicite un septième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
MAHUGNON is a group made up of three members who belong to the same savings group. 

The group's representative, Joséphine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. She is a 55-year-old widow with nine children.  Some of her children are in school and two are still her dependents. She lives alone with the two children who are still in her care and she manages to meet their needs as well as her own, alone.  

Joséphine never attended school.  For the past ten years or so, she has been selling various goods (charcoal etc.) as well as school supplies, from her home.  She is passionate about her work, which allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children. She buys her goods at a market located in Benin.

To ensure the satisfaction of her customers and in order to boost her turnover, Joséphine is requesting a seventh loan, along with the other members of the MAHUGNON group. This loan will help them to better meet their customers' expectations and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and various other goods (charcoal etc...).

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Don Jorge tiene 50 años de edad, tiene dos hijos quienes le ayudan a sembrar y a ordeñar las vacas. Él se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de su padre. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. junto a sus hijos a preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo, debido a que es padre soltero, mientras tanto sus hijos ordeñan las vacas. Luego se dirigen al terreno donde tienen sus cultivos y caminan unos cinco kilómetros para llegar ahí.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo es, para comprar insumos agrícolas, para obtener una buena cosecha. Al tener una buena cosecha, podrá recibir más ingresos que serán destinados a comprar más vacas y a reparar su casa ya que es de adobe y desea construirla de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Don Jorge is 50 and has two children that help him plant fields and milk the cows. He is a farmer, and he learned his trade from his father. He and his children wake up at 4 am. Since he is a single father, he makes breakfast and lunch while his kids milk the cows. Later they walk five kilometers to arrive at the fields where they plant their crops. 

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase agricultural inputs to have a better harvest. Having a good yield will allow him to have higher income that will be used to purchase more cows and repair his home since it is made out of adobe and he wants to construct it with bricks.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs in order to have a better harvest

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Diep would like to take another loan to buy more food to sell from her stall. Diep's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality ingredients to make food for selling.

loans.name: Tram

texts.en: Tram would like to take another loan to buy more cosmetic products to sell from her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy supplies for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of products such as food and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, se le  presento la necesidad de invertir más en su negocio, es por ello que nos solicito otro crédito para comprar vitaminas, antibioticos, productos medicinales naturales y comprar productos de primera necesidad para una tienda que ha logrado instalar como arroz, aceite, condimentos.
Para Juan la experiencia con los prestamos ha sido favorable, ya que sus ventas han mejorado, logro surtir el negocio.en su familia se mantienen, la situación económica mejoro un poco pero necesita mas trabjo para mejorar mas.
texts.en:
Juan needs to invest more in his business, so he is requesting another loan to purchase vitamins, antibiotics, and natural medicine products, as well as purchase basic staples such as rice, oil, and condiments for a store that he has managed to open. 

For Juan, the loan has been a beneficial experience since he managed to stock his store and his sales have improved. The family is able to support itself. Their economic situation has improved a little, but it needs more work to continue improving.

loans.use: purchase vitamins, antibiotics, oil, rice, and condiments

loans.name: Tien

texts.en: Tien is requesting a new loan to buy basic goods to stock her general store. Tien's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en:
