Em, 60, is a villager who lives in Kror kor district, Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married and has four children. Some of her children are working as paid workers and some are assisting Em in her pork-selling business. 

To earn income for her family, Em farms rice and sells pork, the business which she has been involved in for 30 years. Em is a second-loan-cycle client with VisionFund and leads a group member named Ngoun, who is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund, to apply for a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) in total. 

The past loans helped Em to increase her working capital as well as the profit and enabled her to support her family’s needs. She will use her new loan portion, which is 1,000,000 KHR, to buy pig feeds and expand her pork-selling business. Em hopes this loan will allow her to make more money so that the living standards of her family can be improved.

loans.use: To buy pig feeds and improve her pork-selling business.

loans.name: Olouwacheyi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OLOUWACHEYI est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Adjokè Moussilatou est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Adjokè Moussilatou est une veuve et mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Parmi ses enfants, deux seulement restent à sa charge. Adjokè Moussilatou vit donc seule avec ses deux enfants à charge et assure seule ses différentes charges ainsi que celles de ses enfants. Il y a vingt ans environs que Adjokè Moussilatou mène comme activité la vente de mèches, de bijoux et autres produits de cheveux dans un marché du Bénin. Adjokè Moussilatou s’approvisionne au Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Adjokè Moussilatou n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Adjokè Moussilatou et les autres membres du groupe OLOUWACHEYI sollicitent ensemble un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The OLOUWACHEYI group is comprised of three friends who belong to the same revolving credit fund. The group representative, Adjokè Moussilatou, has her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time the group is asking for financial support from ALIDé in order to grow their business.

Adjokè Moussilatou is a widow. Of her six children, only two are still dependent, and all of them go to school. Adjokè Moussilatou lives with her two dependent children and takes care of her needs as well as those of her children.

About 20 years ago, Adjokè Moussilatou started selling hair extensions, jewelry, and other hair products at a market in Benin. Adjokè Moussilatou buys her supplies in Benin.

Her clients' demands are constantly growing, with her limited means, Adjokè Moussilatou is no longer able to respond to their needs. Given that, and taking into account their limited resources, the members of OLOUWACHEYI and Adjokè Moussilatou are asking for a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase personal use products

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of basic goods to sell.

loans.name: Yang's Group

texts.en:
Yang is aged 60 years, and she is a married mother with three children, one of whom is dependent on her and helps the family’s business. Her family resides in a rural village of the Me Mot district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Farming rice on a 2-hectare area of farmland and planting cassava on 3-hectare area of farmland are the main sources of income for her family. She and her husband have been in farming for 40 years. The current business earns her about 70,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Yang is in her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles already. Now leading her group to request a loan, Yang will use her portion to pay for fees on water pumping and pay for labor to transplant rice seedlings. She hopes this loan will help her family increase the income from the rice paddy so as to make the family's living conditions better.

loans.use: To pay for labor for transplanting rice seedlings.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase tables and chairs for his food stall

loans.name: Zubaid

texts.en:
Ms Zubaid is 54 years old, married, and a businesswoman who has owned her own grocery for the past 10 years. She is from Bahawalpur, her store is located near her house and many people wander past there on daily basis. She is earning a reasonable amount of income to support her family members.

She is a mother of five children. She provides for her four children who are going to school. She has gradually improved her business as she has taken several loan from the Kashf Foundation; her repayment behavior is quite good. To continue her operations, she is requesting a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy grocery items, grains and beverages. This loan will be very useful for adding more products that are in demand to her stock for her customers. This would increase her sales and earnings. Her future plans are to improve her house and to turn her business into a larger shop that can serve the greater part of the area.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, grains and beverages.

loans.name: Ndiaku

texts.en:
Ndiaku is from the city of Mombasa and is a merchant. Together with her husband, she has a point of sales where they sell food and drinks. They work in it together. She sells fast foods like flat breads, rice, beans, etc. The food stall is located in a strategic zone of the town, which helps them to have good clientele.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business, like meat, wheat flour, sugar, and more. She appreciates the opportunity for the loan and the good services that the institution provides her for the growth of her small business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business, like meat, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 27 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by practicing dairy farming and sells milk to residents of Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000, to buy more equipment for her business like milk cans, milking gloves, water cans for the cows to drink from and so on.

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her farming activities. Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view to increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy milk cans, milking gloves and water cans for the cows to drink from.

loans.name: Taen's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Taen is aged 45 years and married. She has two children (one daughter and one son), both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Farming rice on one hectare of farmland is the main source of income for the family, and she and her husband have been involved in this for fifteen years. She can earn about 8,000 KHR per day and save about 2,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Taen has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle while the other member is just joining VisionFund this cycle. The first loan helped her relieve the family’s burden. Now she and her group member are seeking for a loan with VisionFund of 1,200,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, Taen is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees in transplanting rice seedlings. She hopes her rice will grow healthily and fruitfully so she can improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees in transplanting rice seedlings.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Phorn is a 57-year-old mother of two children living in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support the family, she has been farming rice on two-hectare area of farmland for twenty years. Low crop yield caused by drought is the main challenge for her business. Phorn can make about 10,000 KHR per day out of her business. 

Phorn is now leading a group of two female members to ask for a loan from Visionfund. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her crops and hopes to make more income through selling rice after harvesting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy has six children; five are in school while the other one works for others for a fee. Thy has supported her family by working on a rubber plantation for fifteen years. She is a widow and 40 years old. As a worker, Thy makes 9,000 KHR per day and manages to save about KHR 2,000 each day. 

Thy has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle. The first loan enabled her to support her children's school fees. Now she is leading her group of four to ask for a loan with VisionFund. Thy, who is the leader, will use her portion to pay to renovate her house. She hopes this loan will allow her to have a proper house to live in and also enable her to have enough working capital to run a business as others do to generate family’s extra income.

loans.use: To pay to renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josephat is 30 years old, married, with one child. He is in the phone accessories and repair business and has been in operation for the last four years earning KES 8,000 monthly. 

He is applying for his third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase hand set covers, batteries, and phones for resale. 

He plans to plough the anticipated profits back into his business and also use some for loan repayment. His hope is to pursue a Degree course in Information Technology.

loans.use: To purchase handset covers, batteries and phones for resale.

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en:
Sokunthea, 37, is a married mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school while the other one works as a paid worker in the local area. Her family lives in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support the family, for the past fifteen years she has earned a living through working as a nurse in the village. This business earns her about 16,000 KHR per day and she can save about 6,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sokunthea’s group consists of four female members who live in the same village and she is a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy school materials and a computer for her children. This loan will enable her to support her children's education with sufficient materials for their studying.

loans.use: To buy school materials and a computer for her children.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 26 years old, married and a mother of three children. She has been in dairy farming for the last two years, whereby she sells the milk to the residents of Malindi town. This gives her a monthly income of KES 10,000.  

She got to know KADET Ltd. through a credit officer, and is applying for her first loan of KES 21,000, to buy milk cans and milking gloves for use in her business. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her farming activities. 

Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view to increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy milk cans and milking gloves.

loans.name: Chhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Chhoeurn is aged 35, and is living in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has two daughters, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support the family, she has farmed rice and raised pigs for ten years and supplemented the income by selling grocery items while her husband works for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 33,000 KHR per day and allows them to save about 20,000 KHR each day for their future needs, after deducting daily expenses.  

Chhoeurn’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and this is the second loan for her group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The first loan helped her to better support her family. Now she and her group member are requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase further her income so as to make a better living and grow the family’s business progressively.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Makupe

texts.en:
Makupe lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. He has one child. He owns a spare parts shop, a business he has been operating for three years now. He also carries out minor repairs and body works. He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the seasonal market. He has been a very dedicated client with on time repayments on previous loans; this is his third loan with Milango.

Makupe is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to purchase repair stock and accessories e.g. shocks, brakes, starter, lights, side mirrors, soldering rods etc. His extra income will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his child. He aspires to expand and have a new outlet.

loans.use: To buy repair items such as shocks, starter, lights, side mirrors and soldering rods.

loans.name: Hassan's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. They have applied for a loan of 17,600,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can meet certain financial challenges that they couldn’t meet if they depended on their salaries alone. And at the end of each month, their school’s bursar repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf. 

The featured leader of this group is Hassan. Hassan is a native of Freetown. He is 32 years of age. He is married to a teacher and the couple has one child. Hassan has requested this loan in order to invest it in business. He will buy local produces like like rice, palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), etc. in large quantity and sell them.

loans.use: to buy local produces like rice and palm-oil in large quantities to sell.

loans.name: Augusta B.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. School staff from this institution like their counterparts in other SMT’ s operational areas come to SMT to request loans. With the help of these loans, they are empowered to do or solve certain financial challenges that their salaries alone can not let them do. And at the end of each month, using their monthly salaries, these teachers repay their Kiva loan. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.  

Augusta is the leader of this group. The 36-year-old is a native of Makeni city. She is married to a police officer and the couple has three children. Augusta is a school teacher and has been teaching for many years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay school fees and other school charges for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees and other school charges for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy lives in Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. He has three children whom all attend school. He owns a tailoring shop, an electronics shop and a hardware shop which he has been operating for five months now.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high transport and fuel costs and competition from other competitors in the industry. 

Sammy is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy building blocks and sand for the hardware store. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He hopes to fully stock his hardware store and employ more workers.

loans.use: To buy building blocks and sand for the hardware.

loans.name: John S. Y.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Allen Town, an outskirt of Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone to apply for a loan of 8,300,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire group in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. Teachers of this institution, like their colleagues in other institutions, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can meet certain financial needs that their mere salaries cannot let them meet. 

The featured leader of this group is John. The 47 year old is a native of Gbendembu village. He is married and has four children attending schools. John is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for many years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy household furniture to decorate his house. At the end of each month, he will repay the loan, using his monthly salary.

loans.use: to buy household furniture to decorate his house.

loans.name: Bawi Lestari 1 Group

texts.en:
It has become commonplace for housewives in Bali to have pigs to raise as a way of supporting the family in addition to the husband’s income. However, the majority of women have problems raising pigs as they do not know the best way of taking care of them and do not have access to funds. To deal with these issues, they join a group to exchange ideas, information and funding.

Ni Nengah, 38 years old, is head of the Bawi Lestari 1 group who run businesses raising pigs. To increase their funds, Ni Nengah inviteed group members to participate in the loan program for small businesses from MUK. This loan will be used to buy piglets and supplies of pig feed. Within five months, pigs can be sold and the profits obtained from this effort will be used to meet the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: To buy piglets and supplies of pig feed.

loans.name: Bawi Lestari 2 Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Ni Nyoman and the other members of the Bawi Lestari 2 group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes. Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Nyoman hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  

Ni Nyoman will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months of fattening. With her profits, she will help support her family by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer. Ultimately, Ni Nyoman hopes that the increased income will enable her to improve her house.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Srikandi 1 Group

texts.en:
The Srikandi 1 group is made up of nine women who are neighbors in the same village, Baturiti, in the centre of Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 22,500,000 IDR, and each member will receive 2,500,000 IDR. The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement their family income, and out of their interest in education in best practices for pig-raising. This is their first loan with MUK.

Ni Made, age 48, is the head of the Srikandi 1 group. She is married and her husband earns money as a farmer, but Ni Made would like to help support her family with her pig-raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork. With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to buy more pigs.

Ni Made is on the back at the left, wearing a red shirt.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Moses Barty's Group

texts.en:
In the picture are primary school teachers from the small town of Waterloo, in Western Sierra Leone. This group of teachers, like their colleagues in SMT’s other areas of operations, come to apply for loans. With the help of this loan, they can meet certain financial difficulties that their mere salaries cannot let them solve. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the repayments on their behalf. 

Moses is the featured leader of this group. The 37-year-old is a native of Yele village. He is married to a trader and the couple has five children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Moses has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена – из Мелитополя. Она работает на одном местном рынке, торгуя мужской одеждой. Торговое место у нее свое. Опыт работы составляет около 17 лет. 
Елена планирует вложить кредит в размере 4 000 гривен в приобретении дополнительной партии сезонного товара под реализацию этой осенью. Она собирается закупить рубашки, куртки и джинсовую одежду оптом для последующей продажи в розницу.
texts.en:
Yelena is from Melitopol. She works at one of the local markets, where she sells men's clothing. She owns her retail location and has around 17 years of experience in this line of work.

Yelena is planning to invest this loan of 4,000 hryvnia into purchasing an additional shipment of seasonal merchandise, which she will sell this fall. She will purchase shirts, jackets, and denim clothing in bulk for subsequent individual sales.

loans.use: to make a bulk purchase of shirts, jackets, and denim clothing for subsequent individual sales

loans.name: Mujeres En Fuerza Y Unión Group

texts.es: Martha tiene 39 años de edad y es originaria de una localidad llamada Coatepec o mejor conocido como San Andrés por el santo que es venerado en  esa localidad. Ella está casada con Miguel Ángel y tienen dos niños que estudian la primaria, dice que ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, como tacos dorados, enchiladas, pambazos, almuerzos, jugos de diferentes sabores, licuados, refrescos, galletas, ya que ella tiene una cooperativa escolar en una primaria donde estudian sus hijos. Dice que tiene con este negocio desde hace 4 años y que a ella le gusta trabajar en la cooperativa porque  así también está al pendiente de sus hijos. Platica que desde muy temprana hora tiene que estar en la escuela para hacer los alimentos que  va a dar de almorzar tanto a los alumnos como a los maestros que  comen ahí. Comenta que a diario sale a surtirse a la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de ella para comprar las frutas y legumbres frescas para que este sabroso lo que da de almorzar. Ella está pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para poder hacer crecer su negocio y comprar un poco mas de dulces y refrescos para tener un poco mejor surtido, comenta que nada mas por las mañanas tiene la cooperativa ya que por las tardes esta otra persona y que ella se quiso hacer responsable de la cooperativa ya que es un trabajo pesado pero que la gente le decía que ella se la quedara por que sabe hacer sabroso la comida y que tiene mucha sazón. La meta que tiene ella es poner un pequeño restaurante ya  que se le está facilitando despachar a varias personas y ella espera que muy pronto se le haga realidad su sueño. Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman María de la Luz, María Luisa, María Verónica, Irma María, Mario, Luz María, María del Carmen y Fanny Mercedes ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de material para papelería, en frutas y legumbres de temporada, en artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, en materiales para estética e insumos para antojitos mexicanos para vender.
texts.en:
Martha, 39, is from a town called Coatepec, better known as San Andrés, which is its patron saint.  She is married to Miguel Angel and they have two children in elementary school.  She sells Mexican snacks, such as tacos dorados, enchiladas, pambazos, lunches, different flavored juices, soft drinks and cookies, through a co-op she runs at the school her children attends.  She says she has been in business for four years and enjoys the co-op activity because it allows her to be near her children.  She tells us that she arrives at school very early in the morning to prepare to lunch for the students and teachers who eat there.  Every day she goes to the wholesale market in the nearest town to buy fresh fruit and vegetables to make her delicious meals.  

She is requesting a loan to expand her business and buy more sweets and refreshments to have a bit more variety.  She only works at the co-op in the morning because there is someone else there in the afternoon, but she wanted to be the person responsible for the business because it is hard work and people advised her to take it over because she is such a good cook.  Her goal is to open a small restaurant since she is servicing many people, and  hopefully she can make her dream come true one day.  

The other members of the group are María de la Luz, María Luisa, María Verónica, Irma María, Mario, Luz María, María del Carmen and Fanny Mercedes.  They will use the loan to buy stationery products, seasonal fruit, grocery store items, beauty products and supplies to make Mexican snacks.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make snacks and refreshments.

loans.name: Jaime Arley

texts.es:
Jaime anteriormente trabajaba en una carnicería y como su sueño era poder trabajar de manera independiente, ahorró durante 7 años y hace un tiempo montó su propio negocio el cual a pesar de no montarlo con mucho capital, con su esfuerzo lo ha sacado adelante y esto le ha permitido salir adelante y superando las dificultades. Gracias a las ventas que ha tenido, ahora tiene la posibilidad de ofrecer más productos a sus clientes, y es por esto que Jaime busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina para fabricar chorizos y también realizar algunas adecuaciones eléctricas en la carnicería.

Su sueño es poder sacar este negocio adelante y continuar progresando con su familia, ofreciéndoles una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Jaime used to work at a butcher shop but he wanted to become independent.  He saved his money for seven years and set up his own business with only a little capital.  Through work he has been able to get ahead and overcome his difficulties. Thanks to his sales volume he now has the opportunity to offer more products to his customers.  Therefore, Jaime is requesting a loan to buy a sausage machine and renovate some of the electric installation at his butcher shop.

His dream is to make the business successful and continue progressing with his family, offering them a better quality of life and economic opportunities.

loans.use: To buy a sausage machine and renovate the electric installation at his butcher shop.

loans.name: Libardo Alonso

texts.es:
Libardo anteriormente trabajaba en una talabartería donde sufrió un accidente y por esto vio la obligación de abandonar su empleo. Cuando ya contaba con la salud para regresar al trabajo, no encontró oportunidades para emplearse y las dificultades económicas en su hogar no se demoraron en aparecer. Fue con la urgencia de mejorar esta situación que logró sacar adelante su propio negocio el cual en un principio solo contaba con muy pocas herramientas de trabajo, pero gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado sacarlo adelante y mejorar la situación en su hogar. Existe otra adversidad que lo acompaña y es que la madre de sus 2 hijos los abandonó hace un tiempo, dejando a su cargo todas las responsabilidades del hogar y el cuidado de sus hijos 2 de 5 y 18 años de edad. Buscando superar una gran dificultad de capital que tiene en su negocio, Libardo busca un préstamo para comprar productos de cuero y responder a unos pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder sacar adelante este negocio y ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Libardo used to work in a saddlery but had an accident and had to leave his job.  When he was well enough to return to work he could find none and the economic difficulties in the household soon appeared.  It was this urgent need that required him to set up his own business, although he only had a few work tools.  But through hard work he was able to get ahead and improve his home situation.  There is also another adversity in his life which is the fact that the mother of his two children left them some time ago, leaving him with the responsibility of caring for the household and raising the two children, ages 5 and 18.  In an effort to overcome the lack of capital he has in his business, Libardo is requesting a loan to buy leather products to fill customer orders.

His dream is to make his business successful in order to give his family a good quality of life and better economic opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy leather products to fill customer orders.

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.ru:
Евгения уже несколько раз обращалась за финансовой помощью к КИВА. В последний раз она использовала кредит КИВА для того, чтобы увеличить количество товара в своем торговом киоске, смогла приобрести много сувениров, подарочные наборы, некоторые канцтовары. Одно время у Евгении были сложности с бизнесом, потому что в городе открылся супермаркет, в котором были довольно низкие цены на канцтовары, поэтому первое время упала выручка, но сейчас торговля снова налаживается. Со времени получения последнего кредита КИВА сын Евгении поступил в ВУЗ, а, значит, увеличились и расходы семьи. 
В этот раз Евгении нужна сумма в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар для школьников и студентов, а именно разные канцтовары, тетради, учебники и т.д. Сентябрь-октябрь – это месяцы, когда хорошо продаются такого рода товары, поэтому Евгения хотела бы пополнить свои запасы товара и удовлетворить сезонный спрос. Более того, со временем Евгения с семьей хотела бы расширить свою предпринимательскую деятельность и заняться еще и сельским хозяйством: осенью они надеются построить теплицу, чтобы выращивать помидоры под реализацию.
texts.en:
Yevgeniya has already turned to Kiva for financial help several times in the past. She used her last Kiva loan to increase the quantity of merchandise in her kiosk by purchasing many souvenirs, gift sets, and some office supplies. At one time, Yevgeniya's business was in trouble after a new supermarket opened and began offering office supplies at low prices. At first, Yevgeniya's profits fell, but now her business is getting back to normal. Since her last Kiva loan, Yevgeniya's son has entered college, which means that the family's expenditures have gone up.

This time, Yevgeniya needs a sum of 4,000 hryvnia to purchase supplies for school and university students, such as stationery, notebooks, textbooks, etc. Such merchandise sells well in September and October, which is why Yevgeniya would like to replenish her supplies and satisfy her customers' seasonal demands. Furthermore, Yevgeniya and her family would like to eventually expand their entrepreneurial activity and engage in agriculture: in the autumn, they are hoping to build a greenhouse in order to grow tomatoes for sale.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for school and university students, namely office supplies, notebooks, textbooks, etc.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена – рыночный предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она занимается торговлей женской одеждой на одном из местных рынков. Елена работает в этой сфере уже 12 лет, за плечами громадный опыт и своя клиентская база. Елена сама растила сына, много трудилась, чтобы прокормить семью и обеспечить достойную жизнь сыну. 

Елене необходим кредит в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить женскую одежду, а именно приобрести кофты, юбки и брюки для реализации в осенне-зимний период.
texts.en:
Yelena is a marketplace entrepreneur from Melitopol. She sells women's clothing at one of the local markets. She has been in this line of work for 12 years, and has a wealth of experience and a large client base. Yelena has raised her son on her own and worked hard to feed her family and provide a decent life to her child.

Yelena needs a loan of 4,000 hryvnia in order to purchase women's clothing, namely sweaters, skirts and trousers, for sale during the fall-winter season.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing - sweaters, skirts and trousers - for sale during the fall-winter season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies such as fabric, thread and other items to fill orders.

loans.name: John Edison

texts.es:
John es un joven emprendedor que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante su propio negocio el cual es un motocarro con el que brinda el servicio de transporte en su municipio. La actividad la aprendió de su padre quien se dedica a esto y desde muy joven se la enseñó para trabajar a su lado, y ahora gracias a esta experiencia ha logrado conseguir trabajo y ahorrar para comprar su propio motocarro. Desde hace muy pocos días que compró su motocarro ha venido trabajando de manera independiente, generando sus propios ingresos con los que contribuye económicamente en su hogar, pero buscando poder tener unas mejores ganancias del negocio, John busca un préstamo para terminar de pagar su propio motocarro y ofrecer el servicio de transporte de manera independiente.

Su sueño es poder sacar adelante este negocio y seguir generando buenos ingresos con los que pueda ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar de sus padres y hermanos.
texts.en:
John is a young entrepreneur who, through much hard work, has been able to get ahead in his business providing transportation service in the city with his motor vehicle.  He learned the trade when he was young from his father who is in the same business, and now, thanks to his experience, he has been able to work and save to buy his own motor vehicle.  Since he bought the vehicle he has been working independently, generating his own income to contribute to the family economy.  But he wants to earn more and is requesting a loan to pay off the vehicle and run an independent transportation business.

His dream is to make his business successful and generate enough income to provide a better quality of life to his parents and siblings.

loans.use: To finish paying for his motor vehicle and offer transportation service independently.

loans.name: Tat'yana

texts.ru:
Татьяна - фермер. С 2007 года занимается выращиванием таких культур как: виноград, клубника, помидоры, пшеница, ячмень.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж. 
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания виноградников, а также клубники.
Для своевременной вспашки и культивации в условиях континентального климата  большой площади земли в 70 соток, Татьяна решила приобрести мотоблок.
В планах на будущие: приобрести мини трактор, расширить площади для посадки клубники и винограда, а также скважина для полива.
В личных планах: Покупка автомобиля для транспортировки товара на рынки сбыта.

Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования мотоблока.
texts.en:
Tat'yana is a farmer. Since 2007, she has been cultivating crops such as grapes, strawberries, tomatoes, wheat and barley. Her husband helps with the business. Tat'yana began her business by growing grapes and strawberries. In order to perform timely plowing and other work on her large plot of land measuring 0.7 hectares, Tat'yana has decided to buy motorized farm equipment, and needs your help to finance her purchase.

Tat'yana's future business plans include buying a mini tractor, expanding the area where she grows strawberries and grapes, and drilling a well for irrigation. She would also like to purchase a vehicle to transport her produce to the market.

loans.use: to purchase motorized farming equipment

loans.name: Marta Rosa

texts.es:
Marta es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a esta cualidad ha logrado superar grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Desde hace un tiempo su esposo murió y quedó viuda a cargo de sus 3 hijos, por lo que tuvo que dejar su trabajo y así poder cuidar sus hijos en el hogar. Sin embargo, como necesitaba poder tener una fuente de ingresos para la familia, decidió montar un taller de confección en su propia casa y continuar desarrollando la actividad en la que siempre se ha desempeñado. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado superar la dificultad de capital y ha podido salir adelante con su negocio, teniendo ahora la oportunidad de generar 2 empleos en su taller de confección y en su hogar brindarles a sus 3 hijos una buena calidad de vida. Buscando seguir creciendo, Marta requiere un préstamo para comprar una máquina resortadora e insumos que requiere para aumentar su capacidad de producción.

Su sueño es tener un gran taller de confección con el que pueda ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguir también generando empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Marta is a very hardworking person. Thanks to this quality, she has been able to overcome a lot of adversity that has happened in her life. Some time ago, her husband died and she became a widow rasing her 3 children. She had to leave her job and take care of her children at home. Nonetheless, since she needed to have a source of income for the family, she decided to open a sewing workshop in her own home and continue to do the activity that she has always done. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to overcome the problem of capital and get ahead wit hher business. Now she is able to offer work to two employees in her workshop and offer her 3 children a good quality of life. Seeking to continue growing, Marta needs a loan to buy a double chainstitcher and materials she requires to increase her production capacity.

Her dream is to have a sewing workshop with which she can offer her family a better quality of life and also continue to generate employment for the neediest people.

loans.use: to buy a double chainstitcher and materials to increase her production capacity.

loans.name: Jesus Angel

texts.es:
Jesus aprendió la actividad de la agricultura de parte de su padre, quien se dedicaba a esta actividad y con la que generaba los ingresos para la familia. Es por esto que Jesus ha heredado el negocio familiar y es quien ahora con el cultivo de verduras y frutas, genera los ingresos que requiere en su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Debido a fuertes problemas de invierno, y ya que no cuenta con un capital suficiente, Jesus busca un préstamo para comprar insumos para reabonar sus cultivos y recuperarlos de los daños que ha causado el invierno.

De esta manera seguirá generando los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos el acceso a una buena educación y ofrecer en su hogar una buena calidad de vida. Su sueño es aumentar los cultivos que tiene para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jesus learned about farming from his father, who worked in this activity and with it generated income for his family. That is why Jesus has inherited the family business. Now, by growing fruits and vegetables, he generates the income he needs in his home where he lives with his wife and 2 children. Due to big problems during the winter, and since he doesn't have enough capital, Jesus is seeking a loan to buy materials to refertilize his crops and recover from the damages.

This way, Jesus will keep generating the income he needs for his household in order to offer his two children access to a good education and a good quality of life. His dream is to increase the crops he has to have more income.

loans.use: to buy materials to refertilize his crops and recover from the damage caused by winter.

loans.name: Leidy Johana

texts.es:
Leidy es una joven emprendedora de 20 años de edad que desde hace 5 años comenzó a trabajar en busca de generar ingresos para su hogar y poderles colaborar a sus padres con los gastos de la familia, ya que pasaban por grandes dificultades económicas. Fue así como inició trabajando como empleada realizando el arreglo de uñas y poco a poco fue adquiriendo más experiencia. Queriendo independizarse y generar su propio negocio, hace 2 meses Leidy tomó unos ahorros y montó su propio salón de belleza donde ofrece los servicios de arreglo de uñas, corte de cabello y otros servicios más, y gracias al cual ahora tiene su propio empleo y puede aportar económicamente para que en su hogar tengan la posibilidad de generar ingresos que le permitan salir adelante. Buscando superar la dificultad de capital y sacar adelante este proyecto, Leidy busca un préstamo para comprar muebles y vitrinas para exhibir sus productos y aumentar las ventas de productos de belleza que vende en su negocio.

Su sueño es poder sacar adelante este negocio ofreciéndole una buena atención a sus clientes y así aumentar sus ventas. Además de poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de otras personas.
texts.en:
Leidy is a young, 20 year old entrepreneur. Five years ago, she started to work in order to generate income for her home and in order to collaborate with her parents on the family’s expenses since they were going through great economic difficulties. This is how she started to work as an employee doing nails and little by little, she acquired more experience. Wanting to become independent and create her own business, two years ago Leidy took some of her savings and started her own beauty salon. The salon offers nail services, haircuts and other services. Thanks to her now having her own business and being able to contribute economically, her household has the possibility to generate income that will allow them to move forward. Looking to overcome the capital difficult and move this project forward, Leidy is seeking a loan to purchase furniture and showcases to display her products and increase the beauty product sales that are sold in her business. 
Her dream is to be able to move her business forward by offering good service to her customers and by doing this, she can increase her sales. In addition, she can create jobs for people who need them most and can contribute to improving the lives of others.

loans.use: purchase furniture and showcases to display her products and increase the beauty product sales that are sold in her business.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria es una joven trabajadora que debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento del hogar, ha decido montar su propio negocio con el cual pueda aportar económicamente a mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y su hijo. Fue así como montó una tienda general donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta familiar y otra variedad de productos, y gracias a la cual su familia ha podido venir mejorando la calidad de vida. Buscando ampliar el negocio, Maria busca un préstamo para realizar una reforma locativa a su tienda, ampliándola para tener espacio donde pueda ofrecer más productos.

De esta manera espera seguir aumentando las ventas y superar las dificultades de capital que tiene, además de poder tener mejores ingresos para su familia. Su sueño es montar un supermercado donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking woman. Because her husband's income wasn't enough to support the home, she decided to open her own business so she can contribute financially to improving her husband and son's quality of life. That's how she opened her general store where she offers customers family shopping basket products and more. Because of this, her family has been able to improve its quality of life. Seeking to expand her business, Maria is seeking a loan to remodel her locale, expanding it to have space where she can offer more products.

In this way, she hopes to keep increasing her sales and overcome the difficulties she has with capital, as well as have more income for her family. Her dream is to open a supermarket where she can generate employment for the neediest people.

loans.use: to do some remodeling on her store, expanding it to have more space where she can offer more products.

loans.name: Srikandi 2 Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan is 55 years old and lives in Baturiti, in the middle part of Bali.  She is married and her husband works as a farmer.  Though Ni Wayan often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income.  She has been raising pigs for 5 years.  

Ni Wayan is the head of the Srikandi 2 group, which is made up of 8 neighbors from the same village.  This is the group’s first loan with MUK.  With the 2,500,000 IDR that Ni Wayan receives, she will purchase three piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more piglets.  With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to renovate her kitchen.

Ni Wayan is on the right, wearing glasses.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 42, is a married man and has four children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He has been a grocery store owner for 12 years. He started his own grocery store with a small amount of capital. He’s a very hardworking man and helps his children have a good life. 

To help continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan of 350,000 YER to buy rice, sugar, beans, candy, snacks, condiments, soft-drinks, groceries, etc. to expand his product inventory. He hopes to enroll his children in school and keep his store stocked so that he can earn income.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, candy, snacks, condiments, soft-drinks, groceries, etc.  for his business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a happy man who treats everyone well because of his opportunities to get ahead. He has a house where he lives with his five children in Sana`a, Yemen. He is an employer in the ministry of agriculture, and he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy electronics materials for his house.

loans.use: to buy electronics materials for his house.

loans.name: Loza Group

texts.en:
This group is called Loza and consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Afrah is 30 years old (she is the second woman from the right side in the photo). She has four children. She has been a sewer for only one year. She works hard to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

During her one year of experience with this typical home-based business activity, she has been able to build up a nice clientele, and she has been successfully meeting her clients' orders.  She applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER to buy fabrics for her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Mriam

texts.en: Mriam, 50, is a hardworking woman. She has eight children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a housewife. She says that she likes her business because it provides a steady income for supporting her family. She intends to buy a rickshaw. She saved an amount to buy a rickshaw, but it isn't sufficient to cover the rickshaw price, so she applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy a rickshaw for transportation.  She hopes to have a grocery store and a bus.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for transportation.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam is requesting a new loan to buy more furniture for her food stall and to buy a motorbike for transportation. This purchase will help her to better attract her customers and provide her family with a means of transportation. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture for her food stall and buy a motorbike for transportation.

loans.name: Guillermo Alexander

texts.es:
Guillermo siempre se ha dedicado a las actividades del campo, pues sus padres generaban los ingresos para el hogar con esta actividad y desde muy joven se la enseñaron para trabajar a su lado. Por esto ahora que se dedica a la crianza de cerdos puede contar con una muy buena experiencia que le permite tener productos de muy buena calidad. Sin embargo, pese a la gran experiencia con la que cuenta, el hecho de ser padre soltero de tres hijos de 11, 7 y 5 años de edad ha hecho que las dificultades económicas en el hogar se presenten constantemente y esto no permita progresar su negocio. Es por esto que Guillermo busca un préstamo para comprar un cerdo de crianza para aumentar su capacidad de producción y así poder aumentar sus ventas.
Su sueño está en poder contar con un negocio más grande donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en: Guillermo has always made a living in activities in the field as his parents generated income for the household with this activity and from a very young age they taught him to work at their side.  It is for this reason that now that he makes a living raising pigs he has very good experience that allows him to have very good quality products.  However, in spite of the great experience that he has, the fact that he is a single father of three children, ages 11, 7 and 5, has made for economic difficulties in the household that arise constantly and this does not allow him to make progress in his business.  This is why Guillermo is seeking a loan to buy a breeding pig in order to increase his production capacity and thus be able to increase his sales.  His dream is to be able to have a larger business where he can generate employment for the neediest people.

loans.use: to buy a breeding pig.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety of vegetables, such as spinach, garlic, cabbage, and carrots. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of vegetables, such as spinach, garlic, cabbage, and carrots.

loans.name: Be

texts.en: Be is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products to sell, such as sandwiches, roasted peanut candies and breads. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of products to sell, such as sandwiches, roasted peanut candies and breads.

loans.name: To

texts.en: To is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials to make ornaments, such as paper, glues and bamboo frames. To's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials to make ornaments, such as paper, glues and bamboo frames.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Quyen is requesting a new loan, which she will use to purchase coffee and glasses and repair her family's motorbike. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers and provide her family with a means of transportation. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall thereby increasing sales and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and glasses and repair the family motorbike.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is requesting a new loan to buy water pipes and materials for making water systems in order to stock his household equipment store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. 

Dung hopes that this new loan will help him to increase the size of his store and increase sales, thereby enabling him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy water pipes and materials for making water systems.

loans.name: Vailiga

texts.en:
Vailiga is 64 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 4 years.

Vailiga has requested a loan to buy some fishing gear. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Vailiga will renew her front porch.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, a spear and fishing net

loans.name: La Buena Union 1 Group

texts.en:
Martha is one of the members of the “La Buena Unión 1 (The Good Union).” They are micro entrepreneurs who sell clothing, shoes, crafts, etc. Their sales points are in the city of Hato Mayor, a farming community in the northeast of the country.

Martha is a single mother of three children, two of whom still live with her. She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been raising her children although she enjoys caring for them and attending church. Martha is very excited about receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza Internacional, having repaid her previous loan satisfactorily and taken an important step toward growing her business. She has had her business for about three years; she started it with her first Esperanza loan.

Martha will use this new loan to buy body lotion, deodorant, shampoo, hair conditioner and other cosmetics. She will use the profits to gradually build her house since her dream is to live in peace with her children in a good house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, and hair and beauty products.

loans.name: La Fortaleza 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Edermiro is the coordinator of the La Fortaleza (The Strength) 1 & 3. This group is located in the town of Hato Mayor, whose economy depends on farming and is in the northeastern part of the country. Edermiro has a wife and nine children, three of whom live at home. 

Edermiro will use this loan to buy different meats. He has a butcher shop where he sells beef, pork, chicken and goat meat. He is excited to be taking his thirteenth loan with Kiva partner Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. Edermiro started his business with his first Esperanza loan nearly seven years ago. His most critical challenge is to save and rebuild his house. 

Edermiro will reinvest the profits in his business and continue to save for the construction of his own house. His dreams are to live comfortably and save with his partner. He became interested in and motivated to join Esperanza after he was encouraged by others in this group to be part of the program and start his business.

loans.use: To buy beef, pork and chicken.

loans.name: Me

texts.en:
Me is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a small business selling barbecue in her community and has been doing this for 3 years.

Me has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken leg quarters, box of mutton flaps (meat from sheep bellies), etc. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Me hopes to expand her business within other nearby villages.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, mutton flaps, soya, onion and sausages

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 21-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Maria has requested a loan to buy sprayers, shovels, crops and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Maria hopes to buy some new uniforms for her children.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, shovels, crops and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products of personal use and overcome her capital difficulties and respond to customer orders

loans.name: La Fortaleza 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Ana is one of the members of the La Fortaleza (The Strength) group 2 & 4, located in the town of Hato Mayor, whose economy depends on farming. Their principal economic activities are selling food, clothes, shoes and accessories.

Ana is very excited to receive her ninth loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having paid off her previous loans satisfactorily and thereby haven taken a step toward growing her business. She has had her business for about four years. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of jeans, blouses, shirts, t-shirts and other items such as shoes.

Ana is a single mother of four children, all of whom live with her. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is working hard to provide for her family's well-being. Her favorite activity is to be at home with her children. She will use her benefits to reinvest in her business and to maintain her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Noatia

texts.en:
Noatia is a 38-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Noatia has requested a loan to buy more equipment such as shovels, a wheelbarrow and chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Noatia hopes to buy some new iron roofing for her house.

loans.use: to buy shovels, a wheelbarrow and chemicals

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
A 37-year-old married man, Lon resides in a rural area of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. He is blessed with one son who is employed as a paid worker.

In the family, Lon is a breadwinner who earns income through planting corn and sesame on three hectares of farmland. He has been involving in this business for ten years, earning approximately 26,000 KHR per day.

He received his first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) one loan-cycle ago and completely paid back the loan. The past loan helped Lon to improve the living standard of his family. Now he is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR to buy a mini-tractor to assist him in his planting business. Via this loan, he hopes to increase his plots of farmland in order to increase his yields as well as his profit.

loans.use: to buy a mini-tractor for his farmland

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala  is a 31-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows kava to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Kalala has requested a loan to buy chemicals, machetes, a wheelbarrow and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Kalala hopes to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, machetes, a wheelbarrow and shovels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase supplies for her taco business

loans.name: Meapula

texts.en: Meapula is 29 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling BBQ foods in her community and has been doing this for four years. Meapula has requested a loan to buy some chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps and sausages. She joined microfinance organization SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Meapula will help out with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chicken legs, mutton flaps, sausages and onions to sell.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El señor santos de 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de  Olanchito, Yoro.  Santos siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Hace 5 años que el realiza sus propios cultivos, donde produce frijoles y café. Sus cultivos los realiza en una zona apta para la producción. La producción la vende en el mercado local y en su casa. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado va pagar mano de obra para sacar la cosecha de frijol y darle mantenimiento de limpieza a la finca de café. Con esta inversión quiere obtener una buena producción. Su meta es darle la educación a sus hijos y el sustento diario a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, age 32, lives with his common-law partner.  They have four children, and they live in a village in the Olanchito municipality in Yoro.

Santos has always farmed.  He has been growing his own crops for five years.  He grows beans and coffee in an area that is suitable for their production.  He sells his production at the local market and at his house.

He will use the loan he has requested to pay for the labor to gather the bean harvest and to provide maintenance by weeding the coffee farm.  With this investment he wants to get a good production.

His goal is to give his children an education and to provide his family with daily support.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to gather the bean harvest and to weed the coffee farm.

loans.name: Helio Manuel

texts.es: Helio tiene 23 años de estado civil Unión libre tiene un bebe de un año. El trabajaba en una librería pero para mejorar sus ingresos  ahorro dinero para tener su propio negocio. En la actualidad se independizo y puso una tienda. El tipo de negocio es una tienda de víveres y su  trabajo lo realiza con su mujer desde de la 6:00 AM hasta las 9:00 PM.  Con el préstamo quiere comprar enlatados, bebidas, granos etc.  El sueño de Helio es tener su propio comisariato y legalizar los papeles de su casa.
texts.en:
Helio, age 23, is in a common-law marriage and has a one year old baby.

He used to work in a bookstore.  However, in order to improve his income he saved money to have his own business.  He became independent and now has his own store.  His business is a store that sells provisions.  He works with his wife from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.

With the loan he wants to buy canned goods, drinks, and grains, etc.

Helio’s dream is to have his own discount warehouse and to formalize the papers for his house.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, drinks, and grains.

loans.name: Ife Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui s'approvisionnent au même lieu. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Odounyêmi Maqsoudath est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un certain Deen. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés, et tous à leur charge. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Odounyêmi Maqsoudath mène comme activité la vente des plateaux d’oeufsde maïs, du charbon de bois et divers articles dans son quartier. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Odounyêmi Maqsoudath sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The IFE group is made up of three friends who stock up at the same place. This is the third time that the group is seeking financial support from ALIDé, in order to boost their business.

Odounyêmi Maqsoudath (the woman who is raising her hand in the photo) is the group's representative. She is 28 years old and married to a man named Deen. The couple has three children, all of whom live in their care. Some of their children have received schooling. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath stopped her studies at the secondary school level. She lives with her husband and children. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath and Deen both provide for the various household needs.

In order to cover the various expenses, Odounyêmi Maqsoudath sells corn, charcoal, trays of eggs, and various other items in her neighborhood. She has been running this business for four years now. She stocks up in her region.

Odounyêmi Maqsoudath, along with the other members of the IFE group, is seeking a third loan from ALIDé to help her achieve her goal of satisfying her customers and increasing both her sales and revenue. The loan will allow the group members to increase their inventory of products and grow their customer base.

loans.use: to buy corn and various other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install security gates on his windows and doors

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
More than a decade ago, Christine and her father moved to Abilene, Texas, for work. Her dad, who loved antiques, taught her to always carry a magnet to decipher between brass and metal when shopping yard sales. As she recalls, “We could always buy good, used furniture, hats, pins and buckles.” Christine would accompany her father at trade shows during her high school years. However, she never truly enjoyed any part of it. “It was horrible in high school, selling cowboy hats in the heat,” she said. “Then I found myself getting good buys at garage sales and found a booth at an indoor market.” 

Seeing there was potential to make a profit, Christine decided to launch The Last Remains, a small, environmentally friendly business that refurbishes and sells antiques. 
 
“Everyone throws something away, but we can take those throwaways and sell them.  For instance, at estate sales, I find old suitcases and then ‘upscale’ them as pet beds,” she says.  Suitcases padded with baby blankets and with chair legs attached, are among her bestselling products. “We take another item like a burned-out light bulb, remove the filament, wash it out with water and salt, then create hanging flower baskets."

Christine said she spends hours cleaning her finds and sells the new creations at an affordable price. Currently, she employs her boyfriend, who also works remodeling homes. When on the job, he obtains reusable items for crafts. For example, he brought a window frame that Christine used as a photo frame, and a screen door, which she spray-painted and uses to display earrings and accessories at shows. Christine gives new life to old items that others would have trashed.  Doing this helps cut down on discarded items that end up in landfills.

Christine and her boyfriend are looking to hire a welder to make animal-shaped objects from old tools and other objects such as a wine racks made from horse shoes and wood. In the future, they plan to hire more employees to assist with working multiple flea markets on the weekends, but Christine’s major plan is to open a store within the next five years. 

She discovered Accion Texas Inc., where she applied and was approved for this loan, through the Small Business Development Center (SBDC) in Abilene. Christine says the loan will go a long way toward purchasing furniture, wood and new materials to immediately begin creating items. 

She showcases many photos on her Facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/thelastremains and her website at http://thelastremains.webs.com. Her father passed away December 2011, but the encouragement and support Christine receives from customers keeps her motivated to continue her father’s trade.

loans.use: To purchase furniture, wood and new materials.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Mohamed from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He is married and has two children, age 5 years and 9 years. His children are currently attending school. 

In 1990, Mohamed established his clothes business. He began his business because he did not go to school and business became his only hope. Before, he was a house helper.

He works at the business every day, 12 house a day. He says that the main challenge to his business is transportation costs.

Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more jeans, T shirts and blouses. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his installment and educate his children. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand his business from retail to wholesale. He thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Mohamed from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more jeans, T shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Tafaumu

texts.en:
Tafaumu is 30 years old and married, with six children. 

She runs a small business selling fish in her community, and she has been doing this for a year. Tafaumu has requested a loan to buy a fishing net, a canoe, and other supplies. 

She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tafaumu will help pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: To  buy a canoe, a fishing net, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rithy's Group

texts.en:
Rithy, a 47-year-old married woman, resides in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. Rithy has three children, one daughter and two sons, all of whom are still dependent on her and currently in school. 

She earns her living through sewing clothes, which she has done for 15 years.  Her husband works as a construction worker to complement income in the family.   Each day Rithy earns about KHR 22,000 and manages to save around KHR 7,000.  Her main challenge is insufficent  working capital for supporting her business.

She is now leading a group of three females to take out a loan with VisionFund. Rithy is a fourth-time borrower, while her fellow group members are a third-time borrower and a first-time borrower with VisionFund. The past loans enabled her to meet the family’s needs and succeded in supporting her children’s schooling. 

With this new portion of loan, Rithy will use as working capital to buy fruits for resale to gain more income. Via the use of this loan portion, she hopes to lift her family’s living standard higher.

loans.use: To buy fruits for resale.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa  is 46 years old and married, with two children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as gel, hair products, and cosmetics, etc. She has been doing this for two years. Temukisa needs a loan to buy some hangers, rolls of material, plastic bags, and a sewing machine. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

She hopes to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine, rolls of material, hangers, gels, and shampoo.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Binta from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed and has two children, age 7 years and 12 years. Her children are currently attending school. As a widow, to educate children in Sierra Leone is very difficult. 

Binta runs a general merchandise store. She sells Maggi (a product for enhancing flavors), onions, tomato paste and salt. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business from 7:30 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She also earns income from small-scale farming. She says that the main challenges to her business are slow sales during rainy season and transportation costs.

Binta has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking seasonings like Maggi, onions, tomato paste and salt. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to become a supplier. She appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Binta from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more cooking seasonings like Maggi as well as onions, tomato paste and salt.

loans.name: Vavao

texts.en:
Vavao is a 52-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Vavao has requested a loan to buy sprayers, shovels, weed killer and crops. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Vavao hopes to renew her house.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, shovels, weed killer, and crops.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Han is 59 years old, married, and lives in a rural area of Mongkul Borey district located in Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She has six children, three of whom are dependent on her. To make a living, she has been involved in a rice-farming business for 34 years, earning around 28,000 KHR per day. 

Han received a microloan from VisionFund seven cycles ago, with which she succeeded in reducing her family’s burden. Now Han is leading a group that consists of four female members to apply for a new loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is seeking 500,000 KHR while her three fellow group members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. As a group leader, Han will use her requested loan portion to buy rice seed and three sacks of fertilizer to apply in her rice field. She hopes to grow her cash-crop timely so as to double her income in order to attain good living progress in her household and to save some money for building her house.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and three sacks of fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Osman from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He married and has no children. He began his business when he left secondary school education and lost both his parents.

Osman runs a phone accessories shop. He sells mobile phones, phone bags and phone batteries. He has been running this business for 12 years. He works at the business from 7:30 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., seven days per week. His business is the only income he has. Osman says that the main challenges to his business are high taxes and no security.

Osman has requested a loan in order to buy more mobile phones, phone bags and phone batteries. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to become a supplier. He thanks you for your support!

video.title: Kiva Borrower Osman from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones, phone bags and phone batteries.

loans.name: Kimhor's Group

texts.en:
Kimhor, 40, is a resident in a rural area of Mongkul Borey district, Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She is married and has five children, four daughters and one son, all of whom are working in Thailand as paid workers. Kimhor makes her living through rice farming as her primary source of income and supplements her income via selling grocery items and sometimes catching fish. She earns around 20,000 KHR per day and is able to save approximately 9,000 KHR. 

Kimhor is leading her group of two female members. Kimhor and her member, Chheang, are requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR, respectively. Kimhor and her group member are second-cycle clients with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. The previous loan has enabled her to secure her business and family’s finances. With this new loan, Kimhor will buy fertilizers to apply on her farmland and buy more grocery items to sell. She believes that via her portion of the loan, she will be able to boost her yield on time so that she can increase her profit and meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and grocery items for sale

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Chanthy is 48 years old, married and has five children. She lives in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. One of her children is dependent on her and still in school. Chanthy is a 20-year experienced farmer who does rice farming to feed her family. Each day she earns around 15,000 KHR and, after covering daily expenses, saves approximately 7,000 KHR. The cost of fertilizers is high and the amount of money that she earns from selling her crop yields is too low to meet the family’s needs. Thus, she and her group members are requesting their first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). As a leader, Chanthy, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and cover the cost of plowing the rice field. She has high hopes that with the use of this loan portion she can improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing cost

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Phay's Group

texts.en:
A villager, Phay, resides in a rural area of Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Cambodia. She is 42 years old and married,  a mother of five children. 

She strives for her living through rice farming and pig raising, while her husband catches fish for sale after helping with the rice-field. The current business enables her to earn about KHR 24,000 per day. She has been with VisionFund for four cycles already and successfully paid back the past loans. 

The past loans that she completely paid back enabled her to buy pigs to raise. Now she is leading a group with a member named Sarin, who also is a fourth-cycled client with VisionFund, to take out a new loan in the amount of KHR 1,000,000 each. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice field and a portion to buy a fishing net to support her husband. 

She hopes to maximize her income from her rice-growing business so she can upgrade her family's living conditions better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a fishing net.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, aged 33, is a resident in a rural area of Ek Phnom district, Battambang province, Cambodia.
