Klever is 26, and lives in Latacunga, capital of Cotopaxi, one of the provinces that forms part of the highland region of Ecuador. 

In recent years, Latacunga has developed to such an extent that it is considered one of the most important cities in the region, thanks to the flower cultivation industry, mining, metallurgy, agro-industry, farming and livestock raising. 

In addition, there are business establishments that generate significant revenues, making it a commercial city with several opportunities to achieve success. Klever is married to Blanca, 25, and they have one son. 

Klever has been working mixing construction materials for five years, and has received the support of Fundación Alternativa through loans he has been granted. 

This time he is applying for his third loan to be able to buy more materials and continue growing. This way his product can supply customer demand. He learned this business from his in-laws, and devotes ten hours to it each day. 

As every father does, Klever has a dream, and this is to see his son become a professional. For this,  Klever works hard, so that his family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials for making cement blocks to sell.

loans.name: Dario Javier

texts.es:
Darío es un joven padre de 29 años, soltero vive con su hijo en Quinindé un cantón de la Provincia de Esmeraldas que provee a varias ciudades del Ecuador productos como banano, cacao, café, palma africana y productos forestales y además el comercio es el trabajo diario de la mayoría de sus habitantes para poder salir adelante y más aún cuando han incrementado las vías para llegar a este cantón. 
Darío ha trabajado por 4 años en su pequeña tienda, en donde todos los días le brinda ayuda su madre. En busca de mejorar sus ingresos económicos Darío acudió a Fundación Alternativa para pedir un crédito el cual le ayudará a comprar más mercadería para llenar su tienda con gran variedad de productos. Darío tiene el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de vida para su madre e hijo.
texts.en:
Darío is a young single father of 26. He lives with his son in Quinindé, a canton in the province of Esmeraldas, which provides several cities in Ecuador with products such as bananas, cacao, coffee, African palm, as well as forest products. 

In addition, commerce is the daily work of a majority of its inhabitants, enabling them to move forward in their lives; even more so, now that the ways to reach this canton have increased.

Darío has worked in his small store for four years. where every day his mother helps him. Seeking to improve his income, Darío approached Fundación Alternativa to request a loan that will help him buy more merchandise to fill his store with a great variety of products. 

Darío has the dream of improving living conditions for his mother and his son.

loans.use: To buy products and improve his business's infrastructure.

loans.name: Wenie

texts.en: Wenie is a modest yet hardworking mother. She is now 39 years old and is blessed with three children. She runs a variety store and this is what occupies her daily schedule. She had been doing this for years and earns an income of approximately P5,000 each month. Wenie needs to earn more money to provide a good education for her three children despite being a single parent. She has insufficient funds and that is why she is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, bread, eggs, milk and sugar to sell in her store. These additional items would help increase her sales thus boosting her profits. In the future, she wants to provide a progressive lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, bread, eggs, milk and sugar to sell in her store

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu is requesting a new loan to buy a larger quantity of garlic to sell. Thu's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of garlic to sell

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is an 18-year-old woman. She is married and has no children yet.

For the past three years, Malak's husband has had a stall that sells fruits and vegetables. This has been a profitable project, but he also needs more support to cover his costs.

Malak is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new, seasonal collection of fruits and vegetables that customers often request and buy. This will increase his sales and improve his family's income.

Malak and her husband are photographed next to their stall.

loans.use: To buy a collection of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marina tiene 36 años y está casada con el Sr. Primo de 52 años,  tienen una hija de 15 años cursando la secundaria.
Anteriormente vendía flores en el cementerio y cuidaba autos,  le conoció a su marido que es empleado, compraron para su casa y abrieron una despensa, empezaron vendiendo bebidas y algunas cosas de despensa, pero luego poco a poco fueron creciendo y mejorando. Actualmente cuentan con una gran cantidad de clientes, le gustaría mas adelante realizar un salón comercial para ampliar su despensa y que su hija termine sus estudios.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, enlatados y demás, con lo que podrá surtir su local y seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Marina is 36 years old and married to Sr. Primo, who is 52 years old and employed. They have a 15-year-old daughter who is attending high school.

Marina previously sold flowers at the cemetery and looked after cars. After she met her husband, they bought a house and opened a general store where they began selling beverages and other products. Over time, they gradually grew and improved their business. They currently have a large number of customers. Later on they would like to have a commercial space where they can expand their store. They also want to see their daughter finish her studies.

Marina is requesting a loan to buy beverages, food, canned goods, and other products so that she can restock her store and continue offering a wide variety of merchandise to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, food, canned goods, and other products.

loans.name: Dúo Piedad De Dios Group

texts.es:
Dúo Piedad de Dios.
Este Dúo está integrado por la señora Felisa quien es originaria de Sumpango tiene 6 hijos ella se dedica a la elaboración de almuerzos desde ya hace varios años es una persona que ha luchado por darles lo mejor a sus hijos en esta oportunidad ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboración de almuerzos ya que necesita elaborar más para generar más ganancias espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Mercy of God Group

This group includes Sra. Felisa, who is originally from Sumpango and has six children. She has been preparing lunches for several years and is someone who strives to provide the best for her children.

Felisa is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy food products for preparing lunches. She needs to increase her production so that she can earn more income, so she hopes that the loan she is requesting will be of help.

loans.use: to buy food products for preparing lunches.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
El Sr. Rodrigo tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, y vive en la ciudad de Caacupé. El Señor Rodrigo es muy trabajador  tiene su propia olería   y su bodega en el centro de la ciudad. Su bodega comenzó con un pequeño capital y con un crédito obtenido de la fundación paraguaya y acompañado del buen trato con sus clientes  el negocio fue  creciendo.
Solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra al por mayor de Bebidas para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes para aumentar sus ventas y por ende aumentar sus ingresos.  Agradece a la fundación paraguaya  y a Kiva el apoyo obtenido para su actividad donde gracias a los créditos y buen servicio otorgado a sus clientes el negocio está creciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Rodrigo is 27 years old, single, and lives in the city of Caacupé. He is a hard worker who owns a pottery shop and a grocery store in the central part of the city. Rodrigo opened his grocery store with a small amount of capital and a loan that he obtained from Fundación Paraguaya. As a result of the good service he provides to his customers, his business has grown.

Rodrigo is requesting a new loan so that he can buy beverages in bulk to satisfy the tastes of his customers. As a result, his sales and his income will increase. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for supporting his business. Thanks to the loans and the good service he offers to his customers, his business will keep growing.

loans.use: to buy beverages in bulk.

loans.name: Monte Verde Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se integra de cuatro personas y que lleva  trabajando con el préstamo varios ciclos y son de un lugar llamado  Benito Juárez  en donde celebran la fiesta de san Felipe en el mes de marzo.
 
    Don Pedro fue quien se le tomo la entrevista  el es nuevo integrante del grupo y tiene dos hijos con la señora Elvia quienes están en primaria y secundaria  y comenta  que son su mayor orgullo para seguir adelante.

   El solicito  el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de lonas  en donde  lleva trabajando  diez años y diez meses en la que comenta que inicio  para poyarse  con los ingresos desde su hogar y pues su motivo es para que su familia tenga lo más necesario.
 
  Lo que desea es que con el préstamo  el pueda seguir aumentado más sus ingresos y su actividad cresada un poco  mas  y así salir adelante con sus hijos.
  
  Su sueño más grande es  comprar una maquina en donde pueda trabajar  con las lonas  que elabora para sus clientes.

  Las personas que se integran en el grupo son las señoras: Flor de Luz invertirá el préstamo en la compra de  zapatos para luego venderlo, la señora Victoria  invertirá en la compra de pollos de  por reja y la señora Celinda invertirá en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio  de abarrotes.
texts.en:
This group consists of four individuals who have worked in several loan cycles. They are from a place called Benito Juárez, which celebrates the Festival of San Felipe during the month of March.

Don Pedro is a new member of the group and was interviewed for this description. He has two children with his wife Sra. Elvia. His children are in elementary and high school respectively. Don Pedro says that his proudest accomplishment is being able to continue moving forward.

He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in materials for making canvases. Don Pedro has been in this line of work for 10 years and 10 months. He says that he started this business so that he could generate household income in order for his family to have what they need. Don Pedro hopes that this loan will enable him to continue increasing his income and grow his business a little bit more so that his children can get ahead. His greatest wish is to buy a machine for his work so that he can continue producing canvases for his customers.

The remaining members of the group are all women: • Flor de Luz will invest her loan in the purchase of shoes for resale. • Sra. Victoria will invest in the purchase of chickens for grilling. • Sra. Celinda will invest in the purchase of merchandise so that she can restock her grocery business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making canvases.

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en:
Baasanjav is a-34-year-old widower who lives alone in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. (A 'ger' is a traditional Mongolian tent.) The district lacks basic infrastructure. He is a teacher at a local college. 

Recently, he moved from his old location to a new yard and is building a dormitory with nine rooms. Besides his teaching job, he is building the dormitory by himself. This shows that he is a very hardworking and ambitious man.  

He has already finished five rooms, and now he wishes to set up low pressure furnace. His previous loan was used to buy essential materials. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to set up a low-pressure furnace before the cold season.

loans.use: to set up a low-pressure furnace at his dormitory.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ferreteria,la socia vende pinturas,clavos y herramientas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar clavos,pinturas y herramientas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to manage her hardware business where she sells paints, nails, and tools. She works from 8:00 A.M to 6:00 P.M. The member has been in business for 10 years and it has enabled her to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand her hardware business, so she is requesting a loan to buy nails, paints, and tools.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy nails, paints, and tools.

loans.name: Gloria Betty

texts.es:
Gloria, nos ha solicitado un crédito, porque necesita comprar frutas para su negocio como lo son: sandia, mango, papaya, piña, melón, etc.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a la compra de frutas frescas, ella se mantiene en el negocio  de venta de frutas y yuca, tostadas, estos creditos le ayudan a mantener más clientes, con lo necesario para ofrecerles. La familia a crecido ya que la señora Gloria tiene una bebe de un mes de nacida.
texts.en:
Gloria is requesting a loan because she needs to buy fruits for her business such as watermelons, mangos, papayas, pineapples, melons, and other items.

Her previous loan enabled her to buy fresh fruit and maintain her business of selling fruit, cassava, and tostadas. These loans have helped her continue gaining more customers by providing what she needs to serve them. Her family has grown since Sra. Gloria now has a baby who is a month old.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, mangos, papayas, pineapples, melons, and other fruits.

loans.name: Virginia Clara

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chompas,la socia teje las chompas y los vende a los diferentes lugares donde venden chompas,la socia se dedica a este negocio 8 años y le va muy bien,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y sean profesionales,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender las chompas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lanas de colores al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is continuing her sweater business. She knits the sweaters and sells them in different places where they sell sweaters. She has been in this business for 8 years and it is going well for her. Through this business, she wants her children to finish school and become professionals. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her sweaters. She is requesting the loan to buy colored wool yarn wholesale.
She is happy for the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy different colored yarns wholesale.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is a 49-year-old married woman with two children, a son and daughter. Her husband works as a security guard. Trang lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Trang has run a business making griddle cakes for seven years. She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a large stock of rice, to increase her production of griddle cakes. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a large stock of rice for the production of griddle cakes.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 39, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Celestino, a school bus driver, and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, Elvira manages their household while operating her business. Currently, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Elvira maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elvira hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to have a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy orders for her customers.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is requesting a new loan to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy food ingredients and meat for cooking and selling. This will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients and meat for cooking and selling.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy a variety of basic goods and household necessities to restock her general store. This will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic goods and household necessities to stock her store.

loans.name: Virginia Alejandrina

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 50 años de edad y vive al lado de su esposo en la ciudad de Chincha, juntos tiene 4 hijos, a quienes ama muchísimo y por quienes se ha esforzado mucho para convertirlos en personas de bien. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima calido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y sus pobladores tienen un don en la preparación de platillos típicos ya que les sale de manera deliciosa. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear con su familia y en algunas ocasiones le encanta disfrutar junto a ellos de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. Debido a sus pocos recursos solo pudo estudiar hasta el tercer grado de educación secundario, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser enfermera.

Día a día Virginia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella le dedica alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy mable y porque tiene productos muy variados para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Virginia esta agradecida con la gran ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, conservas, así como también productos de bazar como adornos, manteles, vasos, entre otros; de esta manera ella podrá tener más variedad de productos y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Virginia is a hard-working woman. She is 50 years old and lives with her husband in the city of Chincha. Together they have four children whom they love very much and for whom they have worked very hard to raise them as good people. Her house is located in the city of Chinca, a city that is known for having a warm and welcoming climate. It is also the cradle of Peruvian sports glory, and its population has a gift for preparing local cuisine, which come out delicious. When she has free time, Virginia likes to go out for a walk with her family and on some occasions, she loves to enjoy with them one of their favorite dishes – the delicious Rice with Duck. Due to their scarce resources, she was only able to study up to the third year of secondary school, but she would have liked to study to become a nurse. 

Day to day, Virginia works in her business selling groceries. She works at it for about 10 hours a day and can serve up to 30 customers daily. She believes that her business is going well because she is very friendly and because of the variety of products she offers her clientele.

Virginia is grateful for the big help that Kiva lenders have provided her, since thanks to the help provided, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, and canned food as well as products such as decorations, tablecloths and glasses. In this way, she will be able to have a greater variety of products and will be able to improve her income, which will allow her to continue fighting everyday to be able to achieve her biggest dream “to have a house of her own”.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar and canned food, as well as products such as decorations, tablecloths and glasses etc.)

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Marcelina, continua dedicandose a la agricultura y la ganadería ,la socia tiene vacas las cuales cria para luego venderlas en las ferias y clientes que le solicitan,a la vez la socia elabora quesos para venderlos de igual forma,la socia lleva años ejerciendo estas actividades las cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de alimentos para sus vacas como forraje y avena.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE", which is in the town of Zurite in Anta Province, in Cusco Department.

Marcelina is still involved in farming and raising livestock, such as cows that she sells at the markets and to individual customers who place orders.  She also makes and sells cheese.  Having been in business for several years, thanks to her hard work, business is going well.  She is a responsible, hard-working person who provides for her family.

The member is requesting a loan to buy animal feed such as fodder and oats.

She values and is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy animal feed such as fodder and oats.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Lucia, continua dedicandose al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos en las ferias y a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia a la vez continua dedicandose a la agricultura ella siembra lo que son maiz,papa y verduras para luego poder venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva buen tiempo en sus negocios gracias al empeño que le pone a cada uno de ellos,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de semillas y abono para su chacra.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE", located in the town of Zurite, Anta Province, in Cusco Department.

Lucia continues with her farm animal business, raising guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells at the markets and to individuals who place orders.  She also continues with agriculture, growing corn, potatoes and vegetables which she sells to individual customers.  She has been in business for quite some time thanks to the hard work she puts into it.  The member is responsible and a hard-worker, making her able to provide for her family in this way.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her cropland.

The member values and is grateful for the loan, and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her cropland.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

El Sr. Anastacio, continua dedicandose a la agricultura y ganadería ,el socio lleva años dedicandose a estas actividades los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a sus negocios,el socio tiene vacas la cuales cria para luego venderlas en las ferias o a sus clientes que le solicitan,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que el saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de alimentos como forraje y avena para sus vacas.
El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE", which is located in the town of Zurite, Anta Province, in the Cusco Department.

Anastacio continues working in agriculture and livestock farming; which he has been involved in for several years thanks to his hard work.  He raises cows to sell them at market and also to individual customers.  He is a responsible, hard-working person who provides for his family in this way.

He is requesting a loan to buy fodder and oats for his cattle.

The member values and is grateful for the loan, and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy animal feed such as fodder and oats for his cattle.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Encarnacion;la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de verduras,la socia vende en el mercado desde las 07:00am hasta la s 13:00pm ,la socia vende zanahorias,zapallo,tomates,cebolla entre otros,la socia trabaja de lunes a domingo en su negocio ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de verduras al por mayor como zanahorias.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE", which is located in the district of Zurite, Anta Province, in Cusco Department.

Encarnacion, the member, is still selling vegetables at the market, working from 7:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.  She sells carrots, squash, tomatoes, onions, etc., Monday through Sunday, and has been in business for quite some time.  Business is going well thanks to her hard work.  She is a responsible, hard-working person who is able to provide for her family this way.

The member is requesting a loan to buy vegetables wholesale, such as carrots.

She is happy about the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale, such as carrots.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 62 años y está casado con María de 61, tienen un hijo que vive independiente de ellos. Habitan en un barrio ubicado en una colina de Latacunga llamado El Calvario. Latacunga es una ciudad de clima frío y es la capital de Cotopaxi, una provincia importante de la Sierra ecuatoriana. Cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos lo que la constituye en una hermosa y acogedora ciudad. El barrio El Calvario es un lugar desde el cual se puede tener una interesante vista de la ciudad y principalmente del volcán Cotopaxi y además es un sitio de recreación muy concurrido por los habitantes de la ciudad.
Este esforzado hombre inició su negocio de elaboración de bloques de cemento hace 12 años y además se desempeña como albañil en diferentes hogares aledaños. Aprendió estos oficios desde hace muchos años atrás y considera que la mezcla de material es un trabajo muy difícil pero que vale la pena con tal de contar con los ingresos suficientes para vivir y ahorrar un fondo que le servirá para sustentar su vejez y la de su esposa. El crédito obtenido lo utilizará en la compra de materiales para elaborar bloques y seguir adelante con la producción de bloques.
texts.en:
Rafael, 62, is married to María, who is 61, and they have a son who lives independently.  They live in a neighborhood called El Calvario on one of the hills of Latacunga.  Latacunga, a city with a cold climate, is the capital of Cotopaxi which is an important province in the Ecuadorean mountain range.  It has several tourist attractions which make it a beautiful, welcoming city.  The neighborhood of El Calvario is a place with an interesting view of the city, especially of the Cotopaxi Volcano, and is a place of recreation for many of the city's inhabitants.

This hard-working man began his concrete block business 12 years ago, and also works as a bricklayer in many homes in the area.  He learned his trade several years ago and believes mixing the material is a very difficult job, but worth it because it provides enough income to live and save for when he and his are older.  The loan will be used to buy materials to make blocks and continue with production.

loans.use: To increase his production of concrete blocks.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el tiene un carro que hace servicio de turismo,ella lleva a turistas a diferentes lugares turisticos y arqueologicos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para mantenimiento de su carro para comprar llantas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antonio continues to work in transport, where he uses his car to offer a service to tourists. He drives tourists to different tourist and archaeological sites, working from 8am until 7pm. This business allows him to provide for his children, and his dream is to buy a new car. His is applying for this loan to pay for maintenance work on his car, which needs new tyres.
Antonio is happy to be able to apply for this loan and promises to fulfill his repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy new tyres for his business vehicle.

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en:
Uzma is a 42-year-old hardworking married woman who is living in a remote area of Punjab Pakistan with her husband and 3 sons. For the past 4 years she and her husband have been running a crockery shop. Her husband also works in a clinic, and her elder son is also running a crockery shop in a market. 

Uzma is a member of an eight-person lending group that has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase crockery items, like glasses, plates, spoons, forks, etc. for her crockery shop, so that she can offer more variety of goods to her clients, and as a result increase her net income in the future. 

She dreams of opening a new shop for her other two sons. She is hopeful that her business will grow more in the future. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so cooperative.

Note: In the picture Uzma is holding a BRAC Pakistan passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase crockery items for her crockery shop.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, in the picture next to his taxi. Faten is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to two sons and two daughters.

For the past three years, Faten's husband has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family, but also it needs more support to cover the cost.

Faten is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to provide a share with her husband to complete the price of purchasing a new taxi. This will improve the family's income positively and create better living conditions for Faten and her family.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing a taxi.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma, She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Wilma hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 27 years-of age, married, and blessed with three children.  Edna’s children are now studying in elementary school. 

Her husband operates a tricycle as a source of income. To add to the income of her husband, she engages herself in fish vending. She doesn’t want to rely on her husband's income. 

To make prosperity in their businesses, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy new tires for her husband’s tricycle and vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband’s tricycle, and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She has been engaged in cell phone loading for four years. She earns about P250 per day. At present, Lorna wants to borrow a loan amount of P10,000 in order to purchase more load cards. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested for further increasing her business income.

loans.use: to purchase load cards.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lindrit

texts.en:
Lindrit is a twenty-three-year-old single male living in Kosovo with the rest of his entire family. For the last 2 years he worked as a hairdresser for others so that he could get experience. This year, together with his brother, he started his own business as a hairdresser.
 
In order to start his business, he was able to obtain most of the money from his parents, and the remaining part will be from the loan. He needs the loan to pay for the start up inventory, such as the chairs, tables and doors. This loan will help him to pay the debts for this business and will allow him to develop his business and increase the number of clients. 

He will use the income generated from the business to support his family. In the future, he plans to develop his business more and to expand by opening another salon, hiring his own employees.

He is very happy for this opportunity!

loans.use: To pay for inventory such as the chairs, tables and doors.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
This is Maria Luisa. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria Luisa hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to have a simple yet happy family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory.

loans.name: Melati Putih Group

texts.en:
With same loan amount and the same members, the Melati Putih Group continue their loan with MUK. This period, the loan will be used to purchase more superior piglets and feed, and to renovate the barn.

Kadek already renovated her barn. Now the pigs do not run away from her yard anymore. It has made her house more clean. Getting full support from her husband, Kadek will use the loan to purchase superior piglets and feed. To manage the cost, she gives combine feed with a traditional feed. She hopes for more success this time, and will be happy with more profit. She also has a dream of fixing her house.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs.Tsetsegmaa is 41 years old and lives with her husband and her two children in a small house in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband's name is Tseren-Ochir. He is 51 years old and works for a local private company as a driver. Her two children are college students. 

Mrs.Tsetsegmaa started her own sewing service business in 1995.  Her monthly income is about 450,000 - 500,000 MNT. She has a current loan for 1,000,000 - 1,500,000 MNT and has been paying her debt on time. Currently, she has over 15 years of experience in the sewing service business and her local residents appreciate her as a modest woman. 

Her family is building a winter house within their fence and Mrs.Tsetsegmaa needs a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase vacuum windows and wood to finish the house.

loans.use: To purchase vacuum windows and wood to finish the house.

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en:
Mr. Sergelen is a 46-year-old taxi driver who operates his business in the boundary districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2005, he has been using the same old car as a taxi. Sergelen lives with his wife and his three daughters on his brother’s plot of land in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. His wife Tuul is a tailor who works from home. 

Sergelen’s best friend Bat has been unemployed for a long time. He plans to start a taxi business, the same as his friend, and he needs to buy a car. Sergelen really wants to support Bat and he is requesting a loan to cover the cost of his friend's car.

loans.use: To cover the cost of his friend buying a taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a DVD player and DVDs for her son's business

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio Julio Cesar tiene 45 años de edad,es soltero y se dedica al negocio de crianza de cuyes,el socio los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria,el socio tambien trabaja en una empresa de seguridad desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de su negocio de crianza de cuyes y trabajo el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de crianza de cuyes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar cuyes al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Julio Cesar is 45 years old, single and works raising guinea pigs. He fattens them and raises them and later sells them by traveling about. 

The member also works for a security company from 6:00AM until 7:00PM. 

Through his pursuit of raising guinea pigs he hopes to get ahead. His dream is to expand his guinea pig business. 

He is asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs at wholesale prices. He is happy for the loan and he agrees to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs at wholesale prices to fatten them for later resale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 34, is a married mother with two children. She is a very responsible and hard-working lady who wants the best for her family. She has been selling clothes for three years door-to-door in the area in which she lives, where she is well known and has several steady customers. 

Asha is seeking a loan to buy a larger volume of clothes, in different colors and sizes, and thereby once again attract the attention of new customers, and at the same time, satisfy her old clients, which would be very positive for Asha and her family. She hopes to own her own boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy a larger volume of clothes to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa; La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de productos secos como trigo,cebada,maiz entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria su mercaderia a sus clientes que mas le solicitan,la socia trabaja desde las 08:00am hasta las 06:00pm aproximadamente,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de zanahorias al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank San Martin De Zurite. The bank is located in the district of Zurite, belonging to the province of Anta in the department of Cusco.

The member’s name is Jesusa. She continues working selling dry goods such as wheat, barley, corn and other items. She enjoys her work which is going well thanks to the efforts that she puts in each day to her business.

She sells her most sought after merchandise to her clients by traveling about. She works from approximately 8:00AM until 6:00PM. She is responsible and diligent which is why her family is getting ahead.

The member is asking for a loan to buy carrots in bulk. She is happy for the loan and she promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy carrots in bulk to sell in her work as a traveling salesperson

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina;la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite,golosinas entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,la socia a la vez continua vendiendo verduras y productos secos como maiz,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como gaseosas para su tienda de abarrotes.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank San Martin de Zurite. The bank is located in the district of Zurite, belonging to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

The member’s name is Sabina. She continues working in her grocery store. She sells staples such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, sweets, and other items. Things are going well in her work thanks to her efforts every day. She continues selling vegetables and dry goods such as corn, and so she is able to support her family. She is dependable and persevering. 

She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks for her grocery store.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her agreed upon payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soft drinks for her grocery store

loans.name: Thiet

texts.en:
Thiet was born in 1983. She has three children. Her youngest child is three years old, the middle one is in the third grade, and the oldest one is in the sixth grade. 

Thiet's husband is a carpenter and earns 3,000,000 VND per month. Thiet does tailoring for a living and earns 3,000,000 VND per month. The total earnings of her family are about 6,000,000 VND per month. She has taken part in the crediting program of SEDA since 2008. The last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more tailoring tools to do her job. She hopes to earn enough money to pay her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring tools
